Reviews.Title: “A great find in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Jerry L
Reviews.Content: We arrived later than expected only to find that they had upgraded us to a suite with great canal views from six windows and large marble bathroom. Definitely not the normal European experience! Great staff and great food combined with great location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Nickysunshine
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel after reading such good reviews on trip advisor and we were not disappointed. We arrived straight to the hotel by private water taxi, a bit extravagent at Â£120 euros but a real treat and makes the trip from the airport to the hotel effortless. The reception staff were all very pleasant and spoke great English. Our room was huge and overlooked the canal which was lovely. We found the room extremely clean and despite another review saying it was noisy at night overlooking the canal we found it very quiet. The breakfast choice was huge cakes, eggs bacon, cheese meats fresh fruit lovely hot chocolate. The two staff serving at breakfast could not do enough to help they were brilliant. Location was great 3 mins from St Marks Square easy to find once you knew - the earlier directions given in another review were very accurate. The only thing that would have been nice was a busier bar area as we found it very quiet, only us there on both occasions we popped in but always open. The courtyard was really nice to sit in and watch the boats and gondalas go by. I would highly recommend the Dona Palace is you like small hotels with charm, friendly staff and want to be close to St Marks Square. It was very clean and despite the odd piece of furniture looking a little dated the hotel is very well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again and again!”
Reviews.Author: Becky T
Reviews.Content: Hotel Dona Palace is a lovely hotel at the intersection of a couple of small canals just behind San Marco. The area is quiet at night but the couple of surrounding streets have several restaurants and wine bars. No internet available in the hotel, but there is an internet point very close by and wifi in the wine bar next door. The location is perfect. Easy to find once you do it a couple of times. We were there on our honeymoon and the hotel very graciously had a wonderful fruit tart and bottle of prosecco waiting for us in the room. It was such a special touch! Our room was amazing and huge but I believe we were upgraded for our special occasion. The breakfast was incredible as many of the other posts have stated. Cappuccino or expresso available on request. Bread/rolls/croissants with jams/jellies, meats and cheeses, scrambled eggs and bacon, cereal, fresh fruit, yogurt and a variety of fresh fruit juices - the whole spread was wonderful and the room is beautiful. The entire staff was friendly and professional. We would recommend this hotel highly to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Lizbee13
Reviews.Content: The Dona Palace is very near to San Marco, but when you step into the side patio you could be a million miles away. It was one of the few places I saw in Venice where you could actually sit in a private area and watch the gondolas glide by - the tourists thought we were residents and kept getting their cameras out to take photos! We had a huge room overlooking the canal and the Bridge of Sighs - nice big bathroom. As everyone else has said, the breakfasts are amazing and the restaurant wait staff are very helpful and friendly. Front of house staff were very professional but not terribly warm and fuzzy. I would recommend The Dona Palace to anyone staying in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel close to San Marco”
Reviews.Author: lobsterpotDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a few hundred yards from St Mark's Square and the Bridge of Sighs, and yet is in a wonderfully quiet position, down a small side alley. This makes it tricky to find at first, but the directions on the hotel's website are good. My room was spacious with a huge, comfortable bed. In fact the small, laptop sized TV was a little lost in the wide open spaces of the room. The decor in the room looked recently done and was in keeping with the area. The communal areas had a few worn carpets here and there but generally the hotel was well maintained. The staff were very courteous and helpful. Breakfast was great. Served in a marbled room overlooking the canal. I can recommend the warm croissants filled with marmalade.

Reviews.Title: “A little surprise in San Marcos square”
Reviews.Author: WittyCutie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a stone throw from San Marcos, although not very easy to find. Shops and restaurants abound, starting within 50 meters of the hotel. The rooms are big, if you consider European standards, but would be average for US rooms. But the service is what takes it home. The staff is friendly and they bend over backwards to accommodate you. We were coming from Rome, by TrainItalia. So, we got off at the last station in Venice and took a vaporetto (you can take #1 or 2, but the #1) and get off at San Marcos-Zacaria (there are 2 stops called San Marcos). Upon getting off the boat, turn left and take the stairs. After the flight of stairs, turn in front of the church and go inside the alley. Turn right after the first store (I mean the store that is adjacent to "Bar American"). Follow that alley all the way, until you see an ATM machine of a bank branch. Take the turn on your left, in the narrow street, just before the bank branch and you'll see the sign that says Dona Palace. If you wait until you arrive to call the hotel for directions, you may get stuck listening to a recording. The person who is supposed to answer the phone is also the only person at the reception, i.e the one dealing with incoming guests, people leaving or going out and handing the keys, etc. So, more often than not. he/she will just let the phone ring and you risk hearing a femaile voice telling you repeatedly to press "1" for front desk, and getting the same voicemal again, when you do press "1".

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: kmbperdon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in March 2012. We took a private water taxi from the airport so it was an easy drop off. The location of the hotel itself is fantastic! It is a short walk to St. Mark's Square and also not far from the public water transportation which we used when traveling to the train station for our next city. There are many restaurants around the area so finding a place to eat was not a problem. The reception was friendly, and when we had problems with our toilet, it was fixed immediately. We booked two rooms. Our room was huge! It had a king bed and a crib for our son, and we stil had a lot of walking space. The marble bathroom was also large. The other room was not as big, but adequate in size. I didn't have too much problem with the noise from the streets. Our free breakfast was delicious and had many options. Free wi-fi was also a plus. The only thing was that they charged us $90+/night for having an extra person in the room. The other room we booked was for 3 people, and the base price was only for 2 people. Make sure you check that before booking. You might get a better deal somewhere else. Overall though, this was a good bargain for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but noisy”
Reviews.Author: 326sian
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in March 2012. The hotel was a bit tricky to find at night but I was thrilled to find that our room overlooked a canal, little did I know that it would be the noisiest hotel I have stayed in! Don't underestimate the volume of traffic on these canals. It starts very early and seems to continue until very late, the engines on the boats roaring, people shouting and then there were the church bells!! None of the churches seem to have synchronised their clocks and seemed to ring forever. The room was large with an extremely high ceiling, the bathroom was very good and everything was impeccably clean. The breakfast was very extensive and generous and all of the staff were extremely helpful, polite and good humoured. I woul stay here again but would bring earplugs next time!!

Reviews.Title: “Not one complant”
Reviews.Author: ChrisandJess2006
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights in Jan of 2012 as recommend by the Rick Steves Italy travel book. As this is the off-season, we were able to walk in and book room 20 for just 99 euro per night which included breakfast and wi-fi. To get this Internet price we paid in full at time of booking. After exploring for two days, we've not seen a hotel better located. It is about a block from St. Mark's Square. The bed was comfortable, there are many, many lighting options, a safe, and plenty of furniture. There is a mini-bar stocked with drinks (coke e3.00, water e2.50). The bathroom is large and well equipped, and there was a small balcony to sit at where you can see a bit of one of the canals. It is our understanding that these rooms rent for way, way more during the high season. We had a very good experience here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location for all the sights!”
Reviews.Author: Kerrie B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 4 night birthday treat for myself in January. We arrived late after as a strike effected all transport in Italy. However, we arrived by taxi boat to san marco and found the hotel very quickly by foot! The hotel is fairly small and full of character! Staff were very friendly and even left a birthday tart with card and plates on by birthday! Breakfast room offered everything you would expect. The rooms very clean! The beds were a little hard but was still able to sleep comfortably. Location great for all venices attractions! Would recommended this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Super location, good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laura W
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Dona Palace, Venice was very nice. Situated seconds from San Marco, the Dona Palace was exceptionally good value. Our room was lovely, very comfortable bed, linen and marble bathroom. I noticed excellent facilities if one was in anyway disabled - lifts, access routes, bathrooms etc. The breakfast had a very good selection. Staff was superb from reception (Farid), to bellboys and waitresses. They made the stay very pleasant. In particular, Farid found us a fantastic restaurant, 2 minutes away and made reservations for us.Charning helpful and funny. Taxi access from private hotel landing made a big difference when exiting the hotel with bags to the airport.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: Tom H W
Reviews.Content: It is very well located for a Venice holiday as it is close to St Mark's Square and its "waterbus" terminal. The reception staff were friendly and always there. The size of our Double room was exactly what we needed. It was warm and clean with a good en-suite shower room. Breakfast was a wide range of foods and more great coffee than I could drink.

Reviews.Title: “Very conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: christiiiiine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Dona Palace this spring and were reasonably happy with it. The location is great, right next to St Mark's Square but tucked a little out of the way (we actually had a little trouble finding it but the front desk at a nearby hotel helpfully pointed the way). The hotel itself is clean and quite cozy, and the staff were all very helpful and efficient. Our only complaint about the room was that it got very warm at night, but if we opened the windows, mosquitoes would fly in. Needless to say, we kept the windows closed and stuck it out in the heat! We departed the hotel from their own water taxi stop, which was so convenient. The taxi was a lot more fun than the buses! (A final note: don't eat at any of the restaurants on the main street near the hotel and the Square. We ate at one on our first night as we were very tired, and boy was it a mistake!)

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel in the Heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Konandreas
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from the Dona' Palace and had a wonderful stay there. Both the architecture and the location provided exactly what I was hoping for - a feel for the history of Venice. It is just round the corner from St. Mark's Square, but in a quiet, secluded enclave that looks onto the same canal as the Bridge of Sighs. The hotel was charming, with a Breakfast Hall right out of a history book - high ceilings, marble floors, venetian windows and wood panelled walls. The breakfast was excellent, with courteous, friendly staff to provide efficient service. The rooms were large and the overall feeling was one of both comfort and luxury. The hotel really is very special.

Reviews.Title: “Coming back again”
Reviews.Author: petespet
Reviews.Content: Having just read the review from the person in Texas, I wondered if they were writing about the same Hotel. They obviously haven't done any homework on what to expect from Hotels on the continent. Very rarely do you get tea/coffee making facilities in your rooms and the hairdryers are nearly always the tube type, they get a bit too hot to hold but you can manage to dry your hair, so what more do you need. We have stayed at this Hotel twice before and are going to book again for March 2012, again coming with two lady friends who came with us last year and loved this Hotel. It IS OLD and the rooms are quaint and this gives the whole place an endearing quirkiness, which we love. If you want all modern stay at the Hilton. We have always found the staff friendly and professional and wonder how they keep their cool when spoken to like servants by some people. Do as you wish to be done by we say. The breakfasts are fine and have the same selection found in most Hotels on the continent. This Hotel is so central and in a busy area so you cannot wonder that there is noise of the locals going about their business, it's part of the life of Venice. We have stayed in at least three other hotels in the Venice, all central and all have street noise. We know that this Texan won't be staying at the Dona Palace again - good, save it for some nicer folk.

Reviews.Title: “A Fanastic Location and Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Seankane
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived by water taxi to the hotels own water taxi stop we were greeted firstly by the beautiful secluded garden facing on to the canal a favorite off mine to have a coffee in the morning and watch Venice go by the gondolas and pace off life .We were greeted with a smile by the reception staff which was Farid a professional and vast knowledge off local information we were directed to our rooms our luggage was carried by a very cheerful and funny porter.The hotel is located close to San Marks Plaza and a short walk to the Rialto Bridge were both both locations a vast number off beautiful restaurants and bistros await you with music .I have traveled to Venice before and the staff off this hotel and accommodation were exemplary .On arriving at our room a complimentary bottle off champagne and strawberry dessert awaited us .The room was well presented and organised from the bath robes and slippers to the bathroom. .The breakfast outside on the balcony overlooking the canal got you set for the day a mix off beautiful Continental breakfast and selection of cereals and juices once again the staff were beyond the call off duty once again.Myself and wife felt like family more than guests from the point off arrival to Farid personal bidding us farewell as we took the water taxi to the airport.In the the morning from about 7.30 am the staff are busy preparing this fantastic hotel so you will hear noise but that said that takes away nothing from the experiences.I will return and look forward to seeing Farid and the staff as much as Venice.Thank you for a wonderful stay and good advice .Sean and Kathryn Kane

Reviews.Title: “Will Not Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: Trisha P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dona Palace for 3 nights and while the location is central, it is also more crowded and noisy. The windows of the room we stayed in did not have adequate sound proofing, noise from the canal and outside would wake us up early in the morning. The breakfast was a nice bonus though, the two waitresses serving the room were always gracious and helpful. The front desk personnel however were rude and abrupt, so that wasn't pleasant to deal with. The rooms are dated and had a musty smell. The bed was uncomfortable, blankets were rough, and the shower drain did not work very well. Overall, I probably wound not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome ! Awesome ! Awesome !”
Reviews.Author: Jinklex
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is just fabulous. Its 1 minute to St Marks Sq and walkable to Rialto area. We booked the hotel based purely on Trip advisor ratings and stayed in the hotel the last week in Aug 2011. We were so glad that we picked this hotel. The set-up is not overly elaborate but very pleasant. The staff was ver accomodating. We were given a nice corner room with a view to a small canal. One one of the nights our air conditioning was faulty. The staff accomodated us by giving us another room for the night while they attended to the issue. By morning the issue was resolved and we had our room back. The breakfast was adequate. On the whole, if we were to vist venice again, we will definitely choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Dona Palace”
Reviews.Author: rmscache
Reviews.Content: This was the second hotel we stayed at while in Venice, and it was not only more expensive, but also dirtier and more worn out. We had such a great experience the previous night and this hotel suffered greatly in comparison. Pros: The Dona Palace is in a prime location, about 2 streets off of St. Marks, and has a cute little patio in the rear of the property that sits along a canal. We enjoyed relaxing there while sitting outside and watching the gondolas go by. The room was more spacious than our first hotel and the breakfast buffet was also more extensive than the prior hotel. The bathroom was spotless! Cons: The hotel needs MAJOR renovation: carpets were worn and dirty (a little vacuuming wouldn't have hurt!), the walls in our room were badly scuffed and desperately in need of fresh paint, the banisters on the stairs haven't seen varnish in this decade...One reviewer noted quiet (soundproof) windows - I disagree. Maybe if you are in a room at the rear of the hotel, however we were in the front, along the street, and had to contend with listening to people talking in the street below, shopkeepers slamming their metal doors shut at night and then slamming them open in the morning, plus the bells of St. Marks go off long and loudly at 7:00 a.m. (I realize these sounds are no fault of the hotel - I am just saying that the windows are definitely not soundproof.) Bottom line: while the room was adequate and close to St. Marks, I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Tired But Still Lovely”
Reviews.Author: margie55
Reviews.Content: We stayed on Dona Palace for three nights prior to leaving on a cruise. We had a lovely corner mini suite overlooking the canal and patio. The room was very spacious for a Venice hotel and clean but the worn carpeting throughout the hotel could use replacing. The beautiful garden on the canal was the perfect place to relax after a day of sightseeing among the crowds. The breakfast room was very nice but obviously not cared for very well as the shelves on the walls were dusty and sparcely decorated. We were relative late (9:30AM) for breakfast and there wasn't much left on the buffet but hot coffee was delivered to our table as soon as we sat down. While the location of the hotel was great relative to the sights we managed to get lost trying to find it a couple of times. We just chalked to it up to part of the adventure of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in the Heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: franknewyork48
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location just 2 minutes from Saint Mark's and about 12 minutes to Rialto Nice breakfast room and a fun terrace (that's great for evening drinks and where water taxis arrive) on a small canal with gondolas passing by all day Room was spacious and quiet with soundproof windows It was very hot in Venice when we were there and I'm glad to say the air conditioning worked well Good size modern bath with spacious shower Lobby is small but who cares?!! The evening concierge recommended a good place to eat seafood 5 minutes from hotel I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “I was supposed to stay for a second time in 2 years.......”
Reviews.Author: DWG10
Reviews.Content: But the price changed 2 times before our stay to much higher....when I asked for a fair review I was told no that even though I had a reservation that they were now fully booked so I was free to cancel my reservation according to their reservations manager. I think that the hotel was nice but that you need to watch how you are treated

Reviews.Title: “avoid this hotel,unfriendly and ironic front desk”
Reviews.Author: Philiposki
Reviews.Content: i staid in room 22 in July 2011 the room is between the restaurant and the alleviator in the morning you wake up at 7.00 because the restaurant open. Wen i complain , The front desk was rood and ironic i never se that thing befor. the only friendly staff were in the breakfast. Bat the breakfast is poor

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BlueMarlinDave
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Dona Palace at the recommendation of my travel agent and as part of a two day Pre-Cruise Package. Check In from the Water Taxi Stand was seemless and quick. I was also provided an AC Adapter and Wireless Internet Code at Check In. Diego at the Front Desk was extremely helfpful and we were offerred a free tour and water taxi to the Murano Glass Factory as part of our stay. We were given Suite 24 which was an absolutely incredible suite fit for a King and Queen. I cannot rave enough about this room and would request it again. The Hotel is located very close to Sain Mark's Square and their are countless shops and restaurants located outside the doors of the Hotel. It is perfectly located to explore all that Venice has to offer. We would not hesitate to book this hotel on a future trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: blairbg
Reviews.Content: Although we stayed in February it wasn't too cold but rather sunny. Hotel situation is close to St. Marks and very comfortable. Would stay again for the off season price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel - location, service and amenities”
Reviews.Author: Chocaholic1001
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights, and once you get over the fact that all hotels in Venice are expensive, then you can relax and really enjoy this hotel! The front desk staff were all very helpful and friendly. The location is perfect - very central and yet surprisingly quiet. We upgraded the room to a junior suite, and it was huge - well worth the extra money! All in all our stay was fantastic, and I would not hesitate to recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: MarkLondonEngland
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel after checking Tripadvisor. It was part of a package from Expedia which included flights and hotel. Overall it was a good choice, with a great location very close to St Marks Square. In the context of the package, it was good value and I would stay there again if the price was right. Our only problem was that the air-conditioning could not be switched on, and it was quite stuffy in the room at times. The front desk was very unclear on the reason - it seemed to be hotel policy not to turn it on until the summer. The room was otherwise very comfortable and the staff helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel - very clean - with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: samsidoti
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Dona Palace before leaving for a cruise to the Greek Islands. The service was great and the front staff was exceptional. They helped us recover our luggage after it had missed out flight. The breakfast was very good. Our room was huge and right off the breakfast room. The only complaint was the room temp. We were not able to turn the a/c down further and it was somewhat uncomfortable one evening. The sister hotel across the street had an excellent restaurant. It is close to everything. I would highly recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to St Mark's Square”
Reviews.Author: ntrinidade
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Venice in March, towards the end of the Carnival. We chose Dona Palace as it was near the main attractions - and it was. Be aware that the rooms are small and there is limited wardrobe space. The buffet breakfast is a mainly a cold breakfast, with more cakes than savoury items - all nice although.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED Dona Palace Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cattynet
Reviews.Content: Dona Palace Hotel is amazing - we were just there from 29 April to 2 May and loved everything about it. Location: Dona Palace is located just a couple of streets behind San Mark's square. Though the square itself is packed with tourists, the little street Dona Palace is on is surprisingly quiet. One issue though - do not follow the Google Maps location for the hotel. See attached photo, the entrance of the hotel is located around the corner from where Google Maps puts you. Getting there: From Marco Polo airport, there's really two ways to get to Dona Palace and it depends on how rich you are. You can take a water taxi which costs about 90 euro and will take you 20 minutes. Or you can catch the Alilaguna (water bus) which costs 15 euro per person and takes 1 hr 15 mins. The water taxi can take up to 8 or 10 people so if you have a big group this might be worth it. The hotel has its own private dock from the canal so the water taxi can literally deliver you straight to your doorstep. The Alilaguna will drop you at San Marco which isn't far either, about 5 mins walk. Rooms: I was worried after reading some reviews about the rooms being small. We booked through eBookers so didn't get a choice of rooms (so I thought we'd get a small one) but ended up with a really spacious room with a private terrace overlooking the canal! The beds are huge, bathrooms are amazing. We had an in-room aircon but didn't need to use it as we could open windows to get the breezes. Staff: the staff at the front desk are super helpful and friendly. They all speak English. Breakfast: breakfast is included - bacon and scrambled eggs, cold meats, cheese, cereal, pastries and fruit and yoghurt. There are also two tables for breakfast on the terrace which is nice if you're lucky enough to get one! Murano Island: if you want to go to Murano, ask at the front desk about how to get there. They can organise a free trip there via water taxi - the only catch is that once you arrive at Murano you have to view a glass blowing demonstration at one particular factory. Good thing is that there is no obligation to buy anything. Otherwise getting to and from Murano costs 6.50 euro per person. You have to find your own way back in any case. Wifi: there is free wifi :)

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Hotel in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: TomR4012
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last year and were pleased to be able to return. Despite its proximity to St. Mark's Piazza and to the popular tourist attractions, the hotel is very quiet and seems somewhat secluded. Most rooms look out onto a canal. There's a quiet garden right on the water where you can enjoy a glass of wine and watch the gondolas passing by. The breakfast is very tasty and generous. The staff is very friendly and tries its best to accomodate every request. Hint: If you stay here, be sure to have the hotel give you detailed directions as it's tucked away in a very narrow passage way.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Janna78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Dona Palace for three nights. I remember making a booking for a basic room, and it sure was basic, very small at least. There was a big closet for one's clothes, with hangers but no shelves. Bed was comfortable and bathroom big enough. TV had lousy channel choices, only one channel where you could here English.. Breakfast was very good, the choices were not too many but they were sufficient. And the coffee, well, I have nowhere had as delicious coffee as I had here! There is a balcony outside the breakfast room, from which there is a nice view to the canal and the Bridge of Sighs. We found the hotel easily, for we had read instructions on this site how to get there. We came from the airport by waterbus and got off at St. Zaccaria, the walk to the hotel took us just a few minutes. I don't recommend taking too heavy luggage with you!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room & great service in Venice”
Reviews.Author: aggiebry
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the Hotel Dona Palace in March of this year. Great location just a block off of St. Mark's square. One note - the entry is on the street just off the side of the physical address. The room was spacious (we were in the Jr. Suite), very clean and very quiet. The staff was helpful, especially the gentleman who worked the desk in the evenings. He went out of his way to make us feel welcome. Breakfast was included in our rate and was very good. In addition to the usual items you'll get in an Italian breakfast buffet (meats, cheeses, juices, pastries) there were also some hot items like eggs. Overall, a great place to stay. Venice is wonderful and the Dona Palace is a great choice for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but didn't meet our expectations”
Reviews.Author: fr3houston
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, but finding it for the first time is a little challenging (but that's the case with anywhere in Venice). It's near a Hell's Kitchen wine bar, on the same side of San Marco's square as the Doges palace. The service was all right, we arrived at 10 a.m. and they didn't have our room ready until 1:30, and they were not sympathetic. They basically implied that it was our fault since their check-in isn't until 2 p.m. The hotel is very small, but quaint. The rooms were the same, small - but very comfortable. Do NOT ask them to schedule the Gondola ride. They quoted 120 euros - we walked about 5 minutes to one of the small bridges, and with only a little negotiation, got a 3km ride for 80 euros. Also, to get to the hotel - make sure you take the Alilaguna and NOT a private water taxi. it was safe, efficient and much more cost effective.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great breakfast, helpful front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Travelers804
Reviews.Content: Dona Palace is a great choice for central Venice! It's a five minute walk from Saint Mark's Square. The front desk staff provided helpful recommendations and maps. In addition, they held our bags when we first arrived and prior to leaving. The breakfast offered fruit, eggs, yogurt, pastries, and dessert-like options. The breakfast hall was spacious and had a full patio overlooking a small canal. Our room was cozy with a small view of the courtyard and canal. The bathroom was clean and provided good bath products. We would recommend Dona Palace to others and would stay again on a future visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Close to San Marco Square... but anything in venice is close”
Reviews.Author: Arpetizor
Reviews.Content: We were booked from 12th July 2010 to 14th July 2010 in a Junior Suite triple. By the name we thought it was an old palace of some sort. Just off San Marco sq [a minutes walk away] tucked into one of the narrow lanes. Small clean hotel with simply appointed rooms. Ours was a suite with 2 rooms a bedroom and a lounge with a sofa-bed. The complimentary breakfast was good but not lavish. The staff was friendly and helpful. The only grouse was the 250 euro/ night tariff - excessive for the class we felt. BTW we also had a cycle bike in our "suite" which did not work. Do remember .... in Europe most hotels do not have iron or electric kettles in rooms. In the website they mention internet but there was no internet available at our hotel we were asked to go to a nearby hotel and use their lobby for internet . Most of the hotels in venice are of the same type therefore i will not have any reservations to recommend this hotel . Our room face the water and could see the gondolas going by.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! Fabulous location and spacious rooms - definitely worth going to”
Reviews.Author: Czaee
Reviews.Content: The Dona palace - its actually a 17th century palace, and is just a minute from St Marks Square and the Doge's Palace and the Grand Canal, so you cant beat the location. The hotel is charming, and our room and bath was surprisingly large, clean and well-maintained. The hotel has its own private dock for gondolas, so you can get right to its doorstep easily. The breakfast was also lovely - a good selection of cheese, cold cuts, pastries etc. Would stay there again happliy.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: Andre_Mattos
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay in Venice at the Al'Angelo hotel, which belongs to the same chain as Dona Palace; amusing hotel, with a entrance right on one of the canals. When we arrived, the concierge said that there was a problem with our booking and we would have to stay at Dona Palace, on a premium room; oh my, how that sounded so good. The staff was perfect, the hotel room exquisite and everything else went smooth ... will stay again on next trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend It!”
Reviews.Author: lfptravel
Reviews.Content: Great location - super close to St. Mark's Square - right on the canal. We took a water taxi to the airport right from the "backyard" of the hotel. Large breakfast space and nice bar in the hotel. Nice outside terrace area. Very helpful staff. MASSIVE hotel rooms - truly huge bedroom and bathroom. Great Find! Wouldnt stay anywhere else in Venice!!

Reviews.Title: “Great find close to San Marco”
Reviews.Author: bluevoter
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located about 2 minutes from San Marco and about 5 minutes from Rialto, so it's very convenient. My room was large, clean, and modern, with free WiFi. The breakfast was well above expectations. I also found it to be a good value for money - at least at this time of year. I also discovered that it's right near the edge of the high tide area, so you might need to wait or buy some boots from the front desk if you want to venture out at high tide.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice people!”
Reviews.Author: TravelDreams
Reviews.Content: A friend and I spent 6 nights here in October 2010. I chose the location because I like to be close to the action at night, and I did not want a lot of bridges to go over to get to the hotel. We both really enjoyed our stay here, and will be recommending to others, and probably go back in the future. Location wise, it is so close to St. Mark's, yet down a quiet alley. I think no matter how you do it, from the airport Alilaguna boat there will be 1 bridge to go over to get to the hotel. We enjoyed chatting with each day and night desk attendant, they were very helpful in recommendations, very pleasant. Our room was nice and spacious compared to most European rooms. We had 2 windows overlooking the courtyard, a little bit of the canal, yet it was super quiet- good quality glass on the windows. The beds/ bedding/ pillow were super comfortable. The bathroom had one of the best showers I have ever had, and an appreciative heated towel rack. We never heard a peep from our neighbors, I think the walls and ceiling are very solid. Breakfast was good, even after 6 times we never got bored, a decent selection of cereals, scrambled eggs, very good juices. I loved the beautiful high ceiling breakfast room. Accessability wise, there is an elevator, but a few steps up to the breakfast room. Most of this area has bridges to get anywhere of course. We did eat at the hotel restaurant once and as soon as we sat down we felt we were in a tourist trap. It is difficult to find a restaurant in the St. Mark's area that does not feel this way - I recommend eating dinner elsewhere in Venice, or for a quick Pizza and drinks, try the close by Planet Pizzaria! We actually ended each day there- just around the corner from Dona Palace. Free Wifi! Worked well in our room- though not fast enough to do a great Skype video call.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: THW_777
Reviews.Content: Value is defined as; Expectation/Price. Dona Palace is a 2 to 3 star hotel, at 275 Euros/night; at that price I expect 4-5 stars. Dona is located close to San Marco. The reception staff is not friendly, not unfriendly but not friendly. The rest of the staff was truly extraordinary, what you expect in the best hotels. The maintenance of the hotel is abysmal, carpets need replacing, walls need to be filled and painted, it is beyond a cleaning staff to clean what needs to be repaired. Our room had beautiful marble flooring, with 5 meter ceilings. The furnishings were in need of repair or replacement. The bed was uncomfortable, (felt like you're sleeping on box springs) the pillows were old and flat, the bed linens were of the cheapest variety. It's all about value, I expect more for what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Central location - quiet spot”
Reviews.Author: june_baby19
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a lovely stay. Very pleasant staff, comfortable room, good breakfast, great location yet quiet, save for the odd singing gondolier!

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem in Venice”
Reviews.Author: sally49er
Reviews.Content: Don't let the small reception area fool you. Our room was huge- approx. 20 feet square! My husband and I just returned from a 7 night stay at the Hotel Dona Palace in Venice, Italy. We couldn't have been happier with the hotel. The staff was courteous, friendly and very helpful. Everyone spoke excellent English which really helped. Our room was very spacious. We had a junior suite with a king-sized bed, couch, large desk, sitting area with a small table and chairs, good sized closet and safe. We had a little view of the small canal just below our window, too. The bathroom was its best feature. There was a large bath tub with a jacuzzi that was big enough for a MBA basketball player to stretch out in. It was all marble and the hotel even furnishes slippers so your feet won't get cold on the marble floors. There was a shower, bidet, double sinks and best of all heated towel racks, too. Probably the best feature of the hotel is its close proximity to Plaza San Marco. It is literally 1 block away. A 5 minute walk from the hotel gets you to the vaporetto, or water bus, that can take you practically anywhere you want to go in Venice. There is even a gelato store next door to the hotel! Given its location, you might expect the hotel to be noisy, but it was surprisingly quiet. My husband is a very light sleeper and he didn't even need his earplugs. There is a full breakfast buffet provided with the room and it as very good. Our last morning, we had to leave for the airport at 5:00 a.m. Our hotel provided us with a sack breakfast with bagels, a croissant, an apple and orange juice that we could take with us. Our water taxi that morning picked us up right at the hotel because it has a private dock. We were very pleased with the Dona Palace. I would highly recommend it to anyone who is going to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, quiet, and well managed.”
Reviews.Author: PaulGofBoston
Reviews.Content: The Dona Palace is a very pleasant hotel very near St. Mark's square. Stayed for four nights in early October in junior suite 23 (talking the recommendation from another reviewer). The room was very spacious and clean with a large bath including whirlpool tub and shower. Immediately outside the room is a common area where breakfast is served and at night there is a small wine bar next to the common area. The breakfast is fairly general, nothing special. The hotel is on a very narrow side street, however, once you find the hotel it's easy to locate. We arrived and departed via water taxi to the train station as one side of the hotel is on a canal and there is a private dock and small, very pretty courtyard. You can sit out there and watch the gondolas go by, very pleasant. I recommend this hotel - you can't beat the location and the room rates are in the reasonable range compared to some other Venice hotels. Rooms 23 and 24 are on the second floor - 24 overlooks the canal, 23 is on the street but with the windows closed there was no noise at all. The hotel staff was always helpful and accomodating. The hotel also owns the HK wine bar across the street which had very reasonable by the glass wines.

Reviews.Title: “Standard amenities, standard fare, location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: simone949
Reviews.Content: A smaller hotel very close to the 'action' - but Venice is entirely walkable. Room was average and hotel had standard fare - European breakfast that was more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: VolvoC30
Reviews.Content: We were booked into the sister hotel the All 'Angelo but on arrival we were upgraded to the Dona Palace. From the moment of check in until departure we were made to feel special by all of the reception staff. The hotel is an example of superlative customer service. We were located in room 51 at the top of the building; it was a suite with excellent facilities including an upstairs terrace that overlooked Venice! What can I say about the breakfast room? it is one of the most beautiful rooms; lots of marble. The breafast itself was excellent with plenty of choice and superb service even though it is a buffet. On departure we had booked a water taxi from the terrace (another gem right on the canal); the front desk guy was alert to the fact that our taxi hadn't arrived on time so he made it his business to follow up the reservation; it arrived in seconds. If I were visiting Venice again I would not consider any hotel other than the Dona Palace. Thanks for a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Loved Dona Palace”
Reviews.Author: ljones3900
Reviews.Content: the staff at Dona Palace really made us feel welcome. the beds were very comfortable and loved the robes the hotel provided. the location is terrific and the breakfast room was so beautiful. would reccomend for sure and go back if ever in Venice again!! this was a clean hotel and again the staff was very helpful in all areas! Thanks for having us Dona Palace!!

Reviews.Title: “A clean, attractive and well-located...”
Reviews.Author: AliRuth
Reviews.Content: A clean, attractive and well-located hotel tucked away behind St Marks Square, but with a quiet ambience and attractive good-sized rooms. We stayed in a junior suite which was roomy and comfortable. A great central location from which to explore the city on foot, and not too far from water bus stops to and from the railway station and airport. Our only minor gripes were not enough clothes storage space in the room and the bar wasn't open in the evenings for some reason. But apart from that we liked the facilities this hotel offered.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: bex00
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 4 day trip to Venice. I travelled with my husband and 5 year old daughter. The hotel is very conveniently located to the major sights. We stayed in a suite which was very spacious but it had no sound insulation between the 2 bedrooms as there was no door. It had 1 bathroom with a spa bath. We could also hear a lot of noise from the room upstairs. We were disappointed with the breakfast which was very basic and had a menu where you could pay more for items which are normally standard e.g fresh juice and boiled eggs. The hotel had a lovely garden where you could sit and watch the gondolas go by. We did use their water taxi to get back to the airport but this was 80 euros. The staff were very friendly and helpful and spoke good english.

Reviews.Title: “Dona Palace a Definite Yes & Book the Junior Suite”
Reviews.Author: desertprincessofca
Reviews.Content: We just spent two weeks in Italy and Venice was our first stop. The Hotel Dona Palace is small, quaint, easy to access-once you know where it is, and is certainly a winner. The reception desk is manned 24 hours straight, so there is always some one available to you. Secondly, the front desk reception is friendly and professional and you feel safe from the madness that takes place outside in those busy alleys of Venice. Breakfast is served on the second floor in a charming setting with an open terrace and pretty ambiance. If you stay in the Junior Suite Room 23, your room is separated from the rest of the hotel and breakfast is just outside your bedroom. If you choose another room, there are lots of steep steps and a narrow elevator. Take the Junior Suite, you will be glad. The room is large and the bathroom has an immaculate large tub. The convenience to San Marco Square and the good shops and restaurants can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Location Great-Service even Better”
Reviews.Author: Eurotraveler280
Reviews.Content: We had booked a jr. suite at Dona Palace and were not disappointed in the room size. We had wanted a canal view so we were upgraded (yes, at a slight extra cost) but the hotel was very helpful getting us a room we would like. Later in the day the aircon went out in our part of the hotel. Here is where the staff did everything possible to help. They brought in portable fans and airconditioners as well as keeping us up to date on the repair process. While the problem was not remedied during our stay the staff service and focus exceeded expectations and we did not feel our 3 day stay in Venice any less diminished. Hotel location is excellent, 300 meters from San Marco piazza and on a canal. Rooms are quiet, breakfast room and breakfast are very good, bathrooms ample size and modern. Hotel has its own boat which can be booked for ride to airport at a reduced rate from the regular water taxi's. We would highly recommend taking a water taxi from where ever you arrive from (airport, rail terminal, car rental) to Dona Palace or whatever hotel you book that is on a canal. Likewise when departing Venice. First of all there is no better way to see Venice and its uniqueness than by boat and the water taxi docks right at the hotel so only a few feet to hotel check in. Yes, the water taxi is a bit pricey (Euro 65 to 90 depending upon distance) but you will not forget the experience. Forget the guide books that say it is easy and cheaper to take the Vaporetto (the public boats). Not if you are carrying or wheeling suitcases behind you and have a backpack as well. For example, the San Marco Vaporetto stop has about 5 stations and they are about a quarter mile apart so unless you are lucky to get off at the stop nearest the hotel and are very good at navigating the narrow streets of Venice along with the tourists in San Marco square, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Charm little hotel”
Reviews.Author: licahil
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel close to San Marco Plazza.We have a large room with two beds and also had a sofa and a table.From window we could see acanal. Nice and clean bathrroom with shower/tub combination.They provide free WI-fi internet acces,and from front desk you can get all sort of maps and brochures. Overall very pleasant stay good quality for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: wattsontoday
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a standard room overlooking the canal, and although well presented and appeared refurbished, wasn't overly spacious. As we spent little time in the room during the day, this didn't matter. We also had the same issue over the air conditioning, and I was bothered by biting mosquitos, as we too needed the windows to be slightly open. I won't repeat the positive comments about breakfast and location, as they are the key selling points of the Dona Palace. Following earlier reviewers, we ignored the retaurants promoted by the hotel, but followed eating recommendations on this website. I had a birthday during our stay, and a welcome touch from the management was the strawberry tart left out for us. There were a lot of other English speaking guests, but I was disappointed that the only accessible English tv channels were Sports and a Chinese news network. As a bit of a news junkie, I would have liked some access to the outside world in English. As the hotel clearly is active in the English speaking markets, I would have thought that this is something that needs resolving. I hope that the management read and respond to this posting (and not ignore it as I only gave four stars!) All in all a good find.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mordonian
Reviews.Content: This hotel was chosen mainly because of it's location (2 minutes walk from St. Mark's Square) and price for the rating, and I can honestly say that I wasn't disappointed. Compared to other hotels I've stayed in over the years this is a relatively small hotel and as a result it has quite a laid back and relaxed feel to it. All the staff were very friendly, polite and helpful. The room was very spacious, quiet, clean and had good en suite facilities. Buffet breakfast was served in pleasant and spacious surroundings, and gave you a good choice of good quality items. Another nice touch with always gets thumbs up from me is free Wi-Fi access.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: MCHayes
Reviews.Content: We stayed our first night at Dona Palace in a junior suite. Upon arrival at the airport, visit the Vistors Information Desk and purchase tickets for the water bus. Exit the airport building andtake a left, following the covered walkway and signs which will bring you to the water (about a 7 minute walk on flat ground). Take the water bus (vaporetto) operated by Alilaguna- red line. Get off at St. Marks Square stop. When you get off, go to the right, towards the square. Make a left into the square (the Basilica will be on your right). Straight ahead of you will be a zodiac clock over an arch. Go through the arch. Take a right at the bank. Immediatly past Al Angelos restaurant take a left. The hotel is on your right, Al Angleo hotel is on your left followed by Hells Kitchen. We arrived early, around noon and could check in (they photo copy your passport). The room was not ready until 2pm, so we freshened up and were able to store our luggage while we started our adventure and found lunch. The front desk even allowed me to call home to my Dad to let him know I arrived safely. Upon returning at 2pm a bell hop (carrying our luggage) escorted us to our room and showed us how to use the small magnet key to get in and turn on the lights! We tipped him 5 Euro. The room (24) was just off the breakfast room (kinda weird, especially in the morning when we opened the door to a room full of people eating!). It was very large, grand! It had a small twin bed, desk and closet in one room, then the master room had a king bed (really 2 twins stuck together), three (flat) pillows, 2 robes, a (closed) fireplace, dressers, large mirrors and headboard, and two windows which one overlooked a canal (so beautiful!). The bathroom had a sink, 2 pairs of slippers, a tub with jets, shower, bidet, another sink, and toilet. Friends were staying at Al Angelo, and it did not compare to my room one bit! Upon leaving the next morning, we again were able to store our luggage with them. So nice. Breakfast was decent. There was cold cereal, yogurt, pound cake, croissants filled with marmalade, yummy potatoes, watery scrambled eggs, bread, lunch meat and cheese. The hotel is very close to St. Marks Square and all the hustle and bustle. Having the junior suite was a nice treat and the size of the room was exceptional! I was surprised to receive a bathrobe and slippers which made it even more luxurious! I would definitly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Dona Palace hotel - Excellent Rooms, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TX_Vic
Reviews.Content: We had been in several cities in Italy with our trip ending in Venice. We stayed 3 nights at this very good hotel. We had booked the Junior Suite because it wasn't that much more than a standard room. I am glad we did. It was a very large room with 2 couches, a desk, and large bathroom. The bed was comfortable and large. The room was very clean but a bit warm as with most hotels in Italy don't turn on the AC until June. We opened the windows even though I feared letting in mosquitos with the fresh air. This was never a problem and we felt comfortable at night. The room was also very quiet even though it faced the street side. Breakfast was the best we had in Italy. There are lots of choices. If you can't find something you like then you must be really picky. Some breakfasts in Italy do not include eggs, sausage, and potatoes. Plus the regular fare of fruit, cereals, meats, and breads. The staff was friendly and helpful. They offered us a 15% discount at restaurants owned by the hotel but I suggest you pass on those as they are very touristy and we felt service at the restaurants was rude and the food mediocre. The Location couldn't be better. It was a 2 minute walk from St. Marks Square. Easy walk with your bags from the Vaporetto stop at San Marco/San Zaccaria (the stop after San Maco). It is perhaps a 10 minute walk to Rialto Bridge. Much faster than taking the No 1 Vaporetto. If I return to Venice or friends ask for a hotel I will certainly recommend Hotel Dona Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel but not sure that I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: annaj11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 days in late May. We had a Junior Suite. It was a large room with a sofa and small table in the same room as the beds. The beds were comfortable. The bathroom was small but was well appointed. The decor and paint of the room have seen better days though. The breakfast buffet had meat, cheese, yogurt, bread, pastries, eggs, potatoes, juice etc. It was great. We ate on the little balcony over the canal. It was a lovely setting. The service at the buffet was excellent. The location is very close to St. Mark's Square so it was moments away from the main tourist attractions. They offered a coupon on checkin for 15% off at 3 restaurants owned by the same company. We found the food to be very touristy and overpriced even with the discount. On arrival, our room was stifling hot. We could hear a fan running so assumed that they had just turned the air conditioning on in our room. We closed all of the curtains in order to help. We went out to sitesee for a few hours. When we returned, despite the fan running and the curtains being shut, our room was still stifling hot. We were told that the AC was not turned on yet for the summer. They indicated that it isn't turned on until June 1. Somehow though over the next 2 days, we had AC off and on. It would work for a couple of hours and then turn off. We stayed at 3 hotels in Italy during our stay but this was the only one that did not have reliable AC. With the exception of one of the daytime front desk attendents who was rude, the front desk attendents were helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, nice room”
Reviews.Author: sgreenwood
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location near St Mark's Square. It was very helpful to stay near a landmark in Venice as the streets are very confusing, but there are signs everywhere to point you to the majors sights. My room was very nicely decorated, spacious and quiet. The staff was helpful, and recommended which shows to see. Some of the front desk staff did not speak any English, though I didn't find it to be much of an issue since I used the free WiFi to look up anything I needed. The breakfast room was very nice, and the selection was great. Eggs, sausage, bacon, croissants, fresh squeezed juice and more. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel at superb location”
Reviews.Author: andre_in_oz
Reviews.Content: We went for a week to this hotel. Upgrade to Junior Suite is worth its money as it offers much space and a sofa. The breakfast buffet is very nice. Around the hotel there are some good offers for restaurants, shops etc. and by foot it's just 2 minutes to San Marco and about 5 minutes to the Vaporetto. The staff has always been very helpful and friendly to us. Can only advise to go to this hotel as I will again when I travel next time to this wonderful city. Go off-season!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: scrg06
Reviews.Content: We stayed in three different hotels during our European trip, and this was by far our favorite. The location was relatively easy to find (a BIG plus in Venice, where it's infamously tough to find anything) and is just off St. Mark's Square. We found it quickly and when we checked in they gave us a coupon for 15% off a few of the wine bars and restaurants in the area (we used it at a restaurant around the corner, which was delicious!). The staff was nice and polite and very helpful when we had questions. Our room was much roomier than we expected, very clean, extremely well decorated, well lit, a lovely view, great working thermostat (apparently a rarity in Europe), and generally comfortable. The bathroom was huge and had a towel warmer (a big hit with our in-laws who came along for the trip). The bed was super comfortable, the free internet worked like a charm, and it was very quiet and relaxing. Our favorite part was the free breakfast, which was huge and awesome. Freshly cooked scrambled eggs, bacon and sausage, tons of pastries and cheeses and cold meats, cereals, juices, fruits, everything!! Best included breakfast we had in Europe. All in all, I highly recommend this hotel. We really enjoyed our stay here and would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Grums
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night November 14th and after re-reading the reviews I guess we got the basic room. #44. We did arrive early after a cruise so it was nice to be able to leave our luggage as we had already dragged it from the water bus stop (which is way cheaper than than frequently noted water taxi) across San Marco and down the street and over a bridge we didn't need to go over and back because the directions as rather poor. Anyway the front desk was very polite and as stated, the room was large enough. 2 windows and a view if you leaned out far enough.The canal side we were on was quieter but the room can get warm even when the controls are turned down. Open the windows and you can get mosquitoes even in November. The breakfast room is lovely and we thought the breakfast was just fine. We'd stay again...now that we know where it is.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: badtraveler45
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. We arrived late at night with our 7 year old almost asleep and we were greeted with smiles and helpful info. We ordered a junior suite (no canal view) but it was very large with room for everyone. The beds were comfortable and the jacuzzi was great!! The best thing about this hotel was the breakfast - absolutely delicious with the best coffee I've ever tasted. The hotel is located right off San Marco square but was quiet and secluded. We will stay there again. The restaurants on the nearby street were not too good so after one bad meal we were a bit more careful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: RNPai
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here from 11th to the 14th of November and found the location great with the accessibility by the water taxi as a result we did not have to drag our luggage through the streets. The breakfast was good and the staff very helpful. The location of the hotel is great and is just a two minute walk to St. Mark's Square..

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jools08
Reviews.Content: Staff friendly and helpful, breakfast was ok, would suggest you eat all you can as eating out can be very expensive. We stayed in room 40 which is a nice room, the only problem being it is dark so you need the lights on during the daytime. If you are going to Venice during the months of Nov/Dec be prepared for floods, most people who had been before had wellies.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Cranleigh
Reviews.Content: Modest sized hotel with an attractive courtyard and private water dock three bridges up from the Bridge of Sighs which we could see (under its tarpaulin) from our room. We had a junior suite with antique furniture and mirrors and (closed) fireplace. Beautiful large room full of character with high celings and views onto the canal. A subdivided area contained another small bed/couch and writing desk. Free wireless internet was reliable, Unusually we had both a shower and a bath. Our teenagers had a superior double, fairly small but with a generous modern bathroom and a balcony with views of the courtyard. Staff were always pleasant and helpful (even offering to set a table when I appeared at 5mins before end of service at 11am in the breakfast lounge). This is on the second floor and is an unusually relaxed attractive room with an evening bar to one side. Once you find the hotel its central location is excellent. (Through Zodiac clock arch from Basilica then first right at the bank and left almost at the end after Angelos restaurant-hotel entrance hall up on the right). We took a private water taxi but high tide meant we were dropped off at St Marks Square on arrival-the boat couldnt get under the canal bridges. Not really a problem as it is only a few mins walk but delightful to be picked up at the private dock to return. We never ate at the local/associated restaurants as reviews were poor.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views, awesome location and great outdoor patio!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug1331
Reviews.Content: This was one our favorite hotels in Europe. Our room (number 26) had the best views of the canal and the outdoor patio. My husband and I would leave the windows open at night and hear the gondolas go by. Great location, the hotel is a few steps away from St Marks Square. Their outdoor patio is so pretty at night with candles, greenery and bar service. Dona Palace had by far the best included breakfast, we were growing tired of the European cheese and cold cuts so my husband was stoked to find eggs, bacon and even mimosas for the last leg of our trip. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Venice near Piazza San Marco”
Reviews.Author: jbp19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for only 1 night before leaving for Florence, but it was an unforgettable stay. The hotel is tricky to find, in a maze of narrow pedestrian walkways near Piazza San Marco--we had to ask for directions twice. Our room was spacious, with comfortable beds, and an extra large bathroom. Our room overlooked a canal with a constant flow of gondolas...very picturesque. The breakfast was great, with a large selection of breads, cereals, yogurt, and a few hot items. We took ours outside, and ate on the adjoining terrace which overlooks a canal. the staff was helpful with stowing our luggage since our train left late in the day. We had a great stay, and would stay there again if we had the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely! Would Stay Again! Handicap-Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: EdenSprings
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel due to proximity to St. Marks (VERY close!) and that it offered handicapped access rooms (traveling with companion in a non-motorized wheelchair who can stand & take a few steps with support). Did we LUCK OUT! First, do yourself a favor and take a Water Taxi from the airport--it's the way to go! Requires a moderate walk from baggage to the taxi dock, but they handle all the luggage. For wheelchair access, dock at the Hotel al Angelo, which is a sister property to Dona Palace--their front doors are just steps away from one another and they will handle your luggage transfer. The Angelo's dock is easier access for a wheelchair or if you can't climb steps. BTW, the wine bar at the Angelo is to DIE FOR! Fabulous food and even better service! If you dn't find what you want ont he menu, just ask. It's a Hell's Kitchen graduate, and was the BEST food on our entire trip! Bonus: The prices weren't extreme, either. Our room had plenty of space for the chair, the bathroom was enormous with a roll-in shower and dual rails for the toilet. We even had a small balcony (no chair access). Lots of closet space and very clean. Don't miss the continental breakfast on the 2nd floor! The room is ligh-filled and the food and service are excellent! The hotel offers a chair lift for those with limited mobility to be able to reach the breakfast room (the bar is also on this level). Tip: Call the front desk when you're ready to leave your toom and ask them to send someone to run the lift. It requires a key to operate it which is kept at the front desk. One of the best-kept secrets in all of venice is the first-floor courtyard on the canal. Cool and lovely--bring your camera for a never-ending parade of gondolas and taxis, a cup of coffee in the morning or a cocktail at the end of the day. Very private and rrestful! Just a short walk to St. Mark's, the Doge's Palace and the Bridge of Sighs (currently sporting a rather ugly advert sign). Be sure to take an evening stroll along the canal in front of the Doge's Palace and watch the gondolas bobbing in the moonlight--very lovely! This is an extremely old building that's been renovated, so some of the rooms are kinda funky in their layout, but they have high ceilings and lots of light. We were booked into a similarly-rated hotel in Rome at the end of our trip, and it was a total disaster, probably made worse because it failed in every cmparison to the Dona! Their Angello sister property also looked sumptuous, and I would consider it as an alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite the 4* billing it promised...”
Reviews.Author: MarkRMC
Reviews.Content: I booked the Dona Palace Hotel for a 3 night stay for my wife's 40th Birthday through the Airmiles website. I then contacted the hotel direct to arrange an upgrade to a suite (Room 12) at a reduced rate and to arrange for their 'Special Guest' Package (welcome drink, gift, biscuits and private taxi back to the airport). Prior to arrival the staff were extremely helpful by email and things boded well for the trip (our first to Venice). We used public transport to get to the hotel (San Marco Alilaguna stop) and after a shortish stroll through St Mark's, we found the hotel easily. We arrived about 9pm and were quickly checked in and shown to our suite. The Hotel. In a good location just off St Mark's Square and by the canal running up from the lagoon under the Bridge of Sighs. However, too close to the tourist traps (see below). The Room (12). Allegedly the best suite in the hotel. Clean, tidy and spacious bedroom with views overlooking the canal (and Bridge of sighs if you lean out!) and the hotel's courtyard. Bathroom fine, but nothing special and separate 'lounge' area, which was actually pretty useless with just a sofa in it. Breakfast. Part of the reason we booked the Dona Palace was for its inclusive full breakfast (unlike many other hotels). This was taken in the 2nd floor lounge and was excellent. Cold and hot buffet and possible to sit on the balcony overlooking the canal or in the air conditioned lounge. Sets you up well for the day, cutting down on the need for an expensive lunch! One drawback is that if you want breakfast in bed it is a 20 Euro (per person) room service charge! Service. The service in the hotel let it down. The hotel is part of a family of hotels and the main one appeared to be the hotel on the opposite side of the street (Di Angelo or something). This meant that there were limited public facilities and the hotel bar was not always open (not at all on the Mon of our stay), which is not good enough for a 4* hotel. Often staff were absent in the other hotel and even getting a cup of tea (at 5 Eruos!) was a chore mid afternoon. The hotel had also not arranged our pre-booked 'Special Guest' package and when I reminded them about our welcome drink (et al), the bar was closed! It was not disastrous, but we'd expected better. Restaurants. There is no restaurant in the hotel, but it has a deal on 3 local restaurants linked to the other hotel (a pizzeria, a standard restaurant and a swanky wine bar (HKs)). You get a 15% discount at these, but I would strongly recommend you don't use them! We tried Angelo's restaurant and even after the discount paid 120 Euros for a decidedly average meal. This was because the hotel and restaurants are just one street back from St Mark's. The second night we headed off the beaten track to a restaurant we found through Trip Advisor (Mascareta), which was half the price and 10 times as good (see separate review!). Departure. Checkout was 12pm and the hotel will look after your bags if you are leaving later. We left from the hotel courtyard on the private water taxi, which was excellent. A bit of weaving through the canals of Venice and then a blast across the lagoon to the airport (20mins in all). Overall. Although we expected Venice to be expensive, this hotel charged 4* rates for what was 3* service at best. You don't get any of the facilities of a modern 4* hotel either and we therefore felt a bit let down. However, it was in a great location, was comfortable and we still had a great trip to Venice once we escaped the main tourist traps. If location is your main consideration, then fine, otherwise I suspect you can find a better hotel slightly further out from St Mark's.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Jim_Cary
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dona Palace for three days before an Adriatic Cruise. Only a few blocks from the P.San Marco, it was still out of the bustle, but an easy walk to the major sites. Staff was very helpful and spoke excellent English. We had a double on the front of the 4th floor. It was larger than I expected, clean and nicely furnished. The breakfast room featured a balcony overlooking the same canal that runs under the Bridge of Sighs, and is bathed in sunlight during the morning. A very nice garden and private dock also backs onto the canal. Breakfast was ample and could be supplemented for those who desired an even bigger meal. The same management runs two other hotels within a few yards as well as three restaurants. We didn't eat in any of the restaurants, but a nice discount was available to hotel guests and all looked reasonably priced and of good quality. Best likes: quiet, comfort and cleanliness. Least liked: Navigating the crowd in P.San Marco with our luggage to get to and from the Vaporetto. You could avoid that with a water taxi to the private landing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.....”
Reviews.Author: Married_Couple_Malta
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel. Recommendable. Location was excellent, just a 2 minute walk to Piazza San Marco. We had a Junior Suite (Room 45) for 9 nights. The room was very spacious with LCD and 2 large windows overlooking the canal and hotel garden. The bed was huge and comfortable with crispy white bed linen every day. The bathroom was very functional and spacious with jacuzzi bath and shower including a window overlooking the canal. The breakfast was american buffet style with a good selection. Everything was very tasty and fresh. The coffee and desserts were exceptionally good. The staff in breakfast room and reception desk were always polite, helpful and efficient. With regards to bathroom cleanliness however, we did not expect to find brownish/green grout showing in corner tiles of shower and jacuzzi bath. Nothwithstanding, there was nothing we really disliked and overall the Dona Palace is a very recommendable hotel offering a comfortable stay within easy reach of major sights.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay, will go back!”
Reviews.Author: carmella19
Reviews.Content: This was our first night in Italy and we were spoiled. The location can't be beat, it is literally right off San Marco square. Our room was very nice but we were upgraded to a larger room than what we had booked, so I think the normal room would have been smaller. Very nice bathroom, mable everywhere, and everything clean. The breakfast was my husband's favorite out of our entire trip. For dinner I would recommend walking a little further away from the square, the restaurants within the block surrounding are too touristy - not great food. We loved Venice and would definitely like to go back. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and good location”
Reviews.Author: LovableLadyinEngland
Reviews.Content: We went to celebrate our 10th anniversary....we pretty much were in the city during day time and only used the hotel to change and night time. As everyone would know, Venice is quite expensive and hotel is quite basic and clean and comfortable for where it is located. However, I would not consider it as a 4 star internationally....may be 4 star for Venice! Concierge services were most of the time helpful but as usual with any place, it always matters who is on duty at any particular time...i.e. some more helpful than others. Location was very good and for that reason, the price was fantastic compared to a lot of other similar hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: LizNPlymouth_Devon
Reviews.Content: We booked through Expedia, and chose this hotel because of its excellent reviews. Although it is in a central location and our room, while small, was very comfortable, and if we hung out one of the windows we could see the canal below! However, I was a little disappointed and considered it was pretty average compared to other 4 star hotels. The breakfast was nice, but we avoided the cooked options as we felt they were unappetising. We celebrated a special anniversary while there, and an acknowledgement of this by the hotel would have been nice. A bottle of sparkling wine would have cost them very little, but might have made us feel more special. We will probably try another hotel next time

Reviews.Title: “Terrific choice for starting our vacation!”
Reviews.Author: JuanitaDallas_Texas
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, courteous and friendly staff, delightful ambience, outstanding breakfast, top-notch accomodations, a stone's throw from St. Mark's and right on a canal with a patio---ideal for relaxing and watching the gondolas go by---WHAT MORE COULD YOU ASK FOR?! I DO recommend arriving by water taxi. It's just too easy and so worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Large Rooms, Helpful Staff, Clean and Quiet.”
Reviews.Author: Bookman54
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a splurge, but delivered! Right next to St Mark's Cathedral, private boat landing near the Bridge of SIghs, immaculate. My better half is a paraplegic in a wheelchair, and the spacious accessible suite, with extra roll-in shower, well suited us. Lavish and tasty breakfast buffet. Friendly staff. Location, location, location!!! We were able to walk/roll throughout the San Marco area, and the close docks for the very accessible waterbuses allowed us to get around to other Venetian neighborhoods and islands. Made an easy visit to a city that, with the bridges and steps, would have otherwise been difficult in a wheelchair. Money well spent to ensure a memorable visit to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: AH1908
Reviews.Content: Great time beautiful juniorsuite with good view. very very friendly staff. as we decided to prolong our stay in Venice they booked us in their sisterhotel without hazzle, again upgrade to juniorsuite. good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Lynne_Ken
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Comfortable Stay. The rooms were huge! We booked a Junior Canal View Suite, and we were so impressed .It had 4 opening windows overlooking the canal. The main bedroom was huge with an oversized King bed and great pillows! There was a smaller 2nd bedroom, which we used as a dressing room. There was also a huge marble bathroom with spa bath! We felt so spoilt, but how many New Years Eve do you spend in Venice? The hotel was clean, had a great lift, a wholesome breakfast, friendly & helpful english speaking staff. It was very close to St Marks Square, yet felt quiet and secluded.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, incredible deal!”
Reviews.Author: colbuck
Reviews.Content: I confirm all positive reviews on this hotel. Rooms are nice and they are big for Venetian standards. Free wifi connection, too. Staff is very helpful, especially a maid named Angela who made every effort to feed my daughter (getting her a cup of strawberries in January!). Location is unbeatable: your are really 50 steps away from San Marco Square and the Rialto area can be reached in less than 10 minutes (walking). As others wrote, the restaurants connected to the hotel do not live up to expectations, at least the one we tried, which serves Italian style-food and pizzas across the street: however it must be said that the San Marco area is only for tourists, so these restaurants mostly cater for these customers and on the whole they offer the so-called "tourist menu" which is a 3-course meal for 15 euro. For a better culinaire experience, move to the Rialto area, crossing onto the west bank of Canal Grande. I recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: tim064
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Donna palace for a three night weekend break to venice with my wife and daughter. location is great, one minute walk to st Marks. Room was fabulous, v spacious with balcony, high ceilings and great full size bath. Staff were generally very courteous and helpful throughout the hotel. In general the service level and staff attitude was first class. Nothing was too much trouble and the service ethos of the hotel was very impressive. Definitely stay again if we visit again and would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel if you are contemplating traveling to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent”
Reviews.Author: Miguel C
Reviews.Content: It has an amazing location, 2 minutes from St. Mark's Square. Compared to many hotels in Venice, it worths it's 4 star rating. Good room, with excelente bathroom, elevator, extremelly nice staff. It was the perfect ending for our honeymoon. Miguel and Sandra.

Reviews.Title: “"Perfect in Every Way"”
Reviews.Author: chicago_young_couple
Reviews.Content: 1 minute walk to St. Marks square. Friendly staff. Big, clean and nicely furnished room. Breakfast was free and excellent. Stayed here for 2 nights in November with my wife (My wife and I are 30 years old). We paid 130 euro per night. Worth every penny. Stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: lunalamb
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at the Dona Palace, it was marvellous. We had a room on the fifth floor up in the eaves so there were lots of wooden beams - full of character! The room was large for a standard double with 4 windows on one side. The bathroom was great and the beds were turned down each evening before our return.
