We had lovely complimentary fluffy dressing gowns and slippers - great for the colder November evenings after a shower! Breakfast was great and the service was excellent, both at breakfast and in the lobby. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: sammyjoo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Dona Palace in August, and I can't adequately described how wonderful our stay was! The positive experience began even before we left Australia, as the contact at the hotel that I was making bookings with via the internet& email was very polite and thorough, and it was this level of efficiency that contributed to us making the decision to stay at the Hotel Dona Palace, as we had never stayed there before. Once we arrived in Venice we splurged on a water-taxi from the airport, and had a very romantic arrival at about 10.30pm, landing directly at the back entrance to the hotel (it has it's own mooring for taxis). Quick check-in, and the porter took us to our room, which was exquisite (from memory, room number 45?)! It was on the 4th floor with windows on three sides of the room. I was absolutely thrilled to find that when I leaned out of our window over the canal I could see the Bridge of Sighs (although sadly it was undergoing renovations and surrounded by scaffolding). We asked for a Junior Suite, and it was one of the biggest rooms we've ever had in a hotel, anywhere. Management had also arranged the chocolates and chilled wine that I requested, so everything about our check-in was perfect. With the windows and blinds closed, there was no sound from the alleyways below, although it was wonderful to open the canal windows in the late afternoons to hear the sound of singing gondoliers. It is literally a two minute walk to St Marks (ironically, it took us a couple of days to find the fastest route of all, but it was still taking less than 5 minutes going our 'long way'). And the immediate shopping area seems to have something for everyone (from traditional restaurants, to souvenir shops, to Venetian sweet stores to McDonalds!). The quality of the accommodation was great - the bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was terrific and there was lots of room for storage. The air-conditioner worked a treat as well, which we were grateful for in the heat of early August. Breakfast was included, and it was delicious. Served on the second floor in a beautiful, high-ceilinged room that had a balcony overlooking the canal, there was a selection available to suit most nations, and the quality of the food was first-rate. And the coffee was heavenly (even my husband, who rarely drinks coffee, was having it every morning in the breakfast room). We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Dona Palace and I would recommend the Dona Palace to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “What an excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel1210
Reviews.Content: This is such an excellent hotel! Recently refurbished, everything looks brand new and clean. I had requested a triple room and they gave us a suite with a beautiful bathroom and a double extra bed! Everything was so clean and well kept. The dining room is a beautiful room with a balcony over the canal, and the breakfast served was excellent. The staff at the front desk was so helpful and professional I was very impressed. The hotel owes two of the restaurants in the street where residents of the hotel get a discount. We had dinner in one of the restaurants and the food was great. And, last but not least, the hotel is in a great location, only a 2 minute walk from St. Mark's Square!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Loved the Dona Palace”
Reviews.Author: SJE1000
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful three night stay at the Dona Palace. I have been to Venice on a few occasions now and this has been by far the nicest hotel I've stayed in. Venice is an expensive place to stay and consequently, some of the hotels are a bit on the small and grotty side, however the Dona was well maintained and had a really nice feel about it. Location couldn't be better. The hotel is situated just a very short walk from St Marks Square. Nearby are some really good restaurants which are worth trying. The room was large and had a comfortable bed, a seating area and coffee table. The bathroom was also a really good size and had a separate shower unit. The bar area is impressive with marble fittings and fixtures and overlooks the canal. The breakfast was fantastic. Really good choice of cold buffet items and hot foods including eggs, sausages, etc. Overall, a great experience, lovely hotel and friendly helpful staff. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: chrisinsd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dona Palace for five days at the end of July 2008, and were so happy we chose this hotel. Check-in was a breeze, and the front desk clerk was extremely polite. Our room (33) was large, and air conditioned. It was a welcome relief from the mugginess outside. I was a little worried at first because our room was right above the bar area, but it wasn't a problem. The room was very quiet. Other good things about the hotel: The outside terrace is lovely. We spent a couple of late evenings drinking a glass of wine and watching the gondolas go by. Its location to San Marcos Square can't be beat. It's literally one minute to walk there, yet the hotel itself is extremely quiet. The breakfast buffet was good, and had ample choices. The one thing my husband and I found a bit odd was the music played during breakfast. For three days straight it was 70s hits. It got to the point where we were playing "Name That Tune." We were actually a little sad when they moved on to more traditional music ... All in all, it was a great vacation, and the hotel was a large part of it. You won't be sorry if you stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Lorrainefox
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last year post cruise for 3 nights. The hotel was a hidden gem tucked away behind st marks square. The room was enormous with 3 sets of floor to ceiling windows overlooking the canal we could see the bridge of sighs from our room.The staff were very helpful and the breakfast was nice Would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Sharon39
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from July 11-July 14th. The location is amazing. Just two minutes from Piazza San Marco and smack bang in the middle of the San Marco district but you would never know it. It was so peaceful, once you closed the door we heard absolutely nothing apart from the occasional early morning "traffic" on the canal behind.The staff were extremely helpful and accommodating - which is more that can be said for some of the people we encountered in other restaurants and bars during our stay ( I got the feeling that some of them were more than a little tourist weary - but then whos surprised with over 12 million a year!) They found out that it was my birthday during our stay and delivered a beautiful gateau to our room with a small card. A lovely touch. Our room was on the small size (we stayed in a standard double) but it was beautifully kept looked out over the canal to the rear of the hotel. We would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LuckyMonky
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in August 2007. This hotel is a beautiful quiet gem right around the corner from St Marks Square. Upon arrival in our room we found a welcoming letter greeting my travel buddy and I as Mr & Mrs. That was amusing considering we are both female, and no, we're not those kind of friends :) The hotel staff were courteous. The bartender served us a complimentary drink in the evening. The courtyard downstairs goes out into a small canal, and it was lovely to sit there and watch gondolas float past. Our room was spacious, clean, and comfortable with air conditioning, a balcony overlooking the water, and all facilities in good condition. Dona Palace is a great place to retreat to after wandering around Venice all day; itâ€™s so peaceful youâ€™d never know there is a busy St Marks Square just a few meters away. Couldnâ€™t find a fault with it - aside from our relationship status getting lost in translation, but that was a good laugh! I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dona Palace was terrific!”
Reviews.Author: ailee
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 51 at the Dona Palace for two nights on our honeymoon. The room is at the top and can be reached by private lift from the 4th floor (or stairs). It has a private rooftop terrace with a full size jacuzzi tub. The room itself was extremely unique and large, with a modern bathroom. The decor was nothing terribly special, but who cares when you have a private rooftop terrace with jacuzzi? The location of the hotel is exceptional, and perhaps because we were on a top floor, we didn't notice any noise issues at all. What really made our stay special was the staff. Our luggage was lost enroute from Heathrow, and they were very diligent in checking on status for us. When we asked to have the jacuzzi tub filled and heated for use, they were very prompt. They arranged a gondola ride and dinner for us, and also, an extremely timely transfer to the cruise ship terminal. Everything ran like clockwork. My husband is diabetic and had neglected to collect his insulin from the minifridge when we checked out, but the staff found it and returned it to us before we left -- thank Goodness for that!! The breakfast may have been the same items every day, but, there were a number of choices so no need to get bored with it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, location and value”
Reviews.Author: finsda
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the end of February 2008. Location was fantastic, only about 3min walk from St.Mark's Square. Hotel staff very friendly and efficient. Room large as was bathroom and very clean. Stayed on bed and breakfast with a typical buffet style breakfast which was fine. Brandy and coffee in the bar before bedtime was a treat in lovely surroundings. We booked a private water taxi from the airport which took us directly to the hotel jetty - fantastic way to arrive. (100euros) On the way back to the airport we booked a water taxi through the hotel. Surprisingly this was only 80 euros, 20euros less than the one we booked from the airport. Hotel does not have a resturant but they do give you discount vouchers at 2 nearby resturants. This didn't bother us though as we like to find our own way. Venice was fantastic and we will no doubt return at some point where we will definatelky book again at the Dona Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Dona Palace is not a palace - don't go!”
Reviews.Author: themidge714
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Dona Palace for three nights in late April/early May. We had just come from Amsterdam and Prague, where we stayed at two lovely hotels. Dona Palace was, to say the least,tremendously disappointing for the ranking it has been given and for the money that we paid for a junior suite. While the room itself was very nice - large, clean, etc. - the shower leaked into one part of the room and there was constant wetness, i.e., a puddle, on the carpet on that side of the room. We could have dealt with this if it was not for the noise and the heat. Venice was wall-to-wall tourists - and our hotel was located very close to San Marco Plaza, which should have been a plus. However, because of this, the noise from the tourists, the restaurants, the canals, and other commotion started at 9 AM and did not let up until 11:00 PM. If we shut the windows (which is what the hotel advised to keep out the noise), the temperature in the room soared to 80 degrees F - it was stifling, but quiet. If we opened the windows, we had a draft but could not sleep. However, hotel would not turn on the air conditioning. We spent two nights feeling either uncomfortably warm and unable to sleep, or disturbed by the noise and unable to sleep. Our room was also located by the hotel bar, so the loud music from that (although totally empty) was another disturbance, although reception did turn it off immediately when we asked if it could be turned down. At a room this expensive, all of this was just unacceptable. Breakfast was included in the price of the room. As I mentioned before, we had just spent time in two hotels in two different countries with large buffet breakfasts that were excellent. The breakfast at Dona Palace was horrible - the coffee was watered down and cold, the eggs may have been powdered, the yogurt was not that lovely Italian yogurt in glass containers, but a garden variety grocery story kind, cheese was in little foil packets, the bread was stale and the croissants certainly did not come from a bakery, and on and on and on. Above all, the total indifference of the front desk - with the exception of one person, who arranged for us to see a different room -was maddening. They were less than helpful when we asked what to do about the room on more than one occasion, and overall, we felt that the attitude was one of: "Well, there are lots of tourists - we don't have time to please everyone." This was so different from the accommodations, concern, and friendliness that we received in the other two places that we were taken aback. We read TripAdvisor reviews all the time and our travel agent selected the hotel mostly based on the high ratings given Dona Palace. We usually think that those people who give low ratings to hotels are just "whiny" if all the other reviews are superior. This is the first time that we have written and now we see why. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone for any reason. Perhaps if it was after 5/15 and the AC could have been used, we would have had a different experience, but then, that would not have changed the service.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not quite a "palace" for us”
Reviews.Author: paob
Reviews.Content: Good points: This hotel is in a great location, the staff were very friendly and helpful. The whole hotel is very well kept, very clean. Our room was on the 5th floor, so very quiet and quite spacious. Top tip: make sure you know where it is, stand in front of the Basilica in St Marks square, go down the alley to the left of the Basilica and take the 2nd or 3rd alley on the left (the last one before the bridge. Not so good: My friend and I booked a twin, but the 2 single beds were pushed together, so it was like a double. The beds were so hard and the room too warm so we didn't get much sleep. We would have liked to have a drink in the bar but it was empty every night that we were there. The breakfast was OK. We stayed for 4 days and it was the same every day, would have been nice to have had some variety. Tried to book a water taxi, through the hotel, back to the airport but it was 90 euros so didn't bother. One of the other reviews mentioned that there are no English channels on the TV, I thought this was funny as didn't think we would be watching much TV, but after a day walking around venice all day it would have been nice to just chill in the room and watch a program with a nice cup of tea (no tea making facilities in the rooms). On balance, I would stay at this hotel again but ask for a different room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel-Good Location”
Reviews.Author: mschneider
Reviews.Content: Stayed off-season at a discounted rate. Had no problems with the hotel at all. Room was perfect and surprisingly big for cramped Venice. WiFi internet was free (you have to get a password at the front desk), and the breakfast buffet excellent. My only interaction with the staff was at check-in/out, and they were very friendly and efficient. Location was excellent-just off St Marks Square. Finding the hotel was tricky. The map on the hotel's own website links to Google Maps, and it screwed up on the location big time. I spent almost an hour looking for the hotel. Rick's Steves guidebook has the location accurately on it's map- if you pass by a McDonald's, you headed in the right direction. Be warned that the food in Venice is mediocre! Most all restaurants in the tourist areas cater exclusively to tourists so they don't have to rely on repeat business.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bschwed
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Dona Palace for 3 nights. It was wonderful. Easy access to all of Venice, very helpful staff, and a nice breakfast buffet. The rooms were great, with nice beds and a TV. Our room did not have a view though. However, with it's great location in Venice, we were able to have plenty of fun and easily get anywhere and do what we wanted. Great Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not a whole lot else for your money”
Reviews.Author: EPJD
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 6, youngest is 15, and we stayed at the Dona Palace for four nights over New Years Eve. Overall, the hotel was adequate, but not great value for the money. We reserved two suites. The suites were large enough and each had a separate sitting area with a pull-out couch that served as a second bedroom for our purposes. The rooms were clean, but not very comfortable. The pillows weren't very good, and the two pull-out couches were very uncomfortable. We had to ask for a second mattress for each pull-out just to get a good night's sleep. The rooms didn't have any furniture other than the bed, a small table with 2 chairs, and a desk with a chair. You would expect a suite to have more comfortable furniture for sitting and relaxing. We were more comfortable in other hotel suites and junior suites where we stayed during other parts of our trip. The rooms were not very well-lit. The bathrooms were fine. As we were warned by other reviews, the hotel really pushed their own restaurants. This was frustrating because we were there over New Years Eve and had hoped for some good recommendations for the holiday. The staff at the front desk was not helpful; they said we should walk around and see if we found anything appealing on our own. Even when we asked about restaurants weâ€™d read about, they didn't have anything helpful to offer. They directed us to a very touristy dinner show and acted annoyed when we asked for advice. When we asked them to call to make reservations for restaurants we found on our own, on two occasions they forgot or just never did it. However, service outside of the front desk was very good. The buffet breakfast that was included with our rate was in a beautiful room. The one young woman who waited tables was very helpful and friendly. The breakfast spread was very adequate and tasty. The hotel was a little difficult to find, but when we arrived we called the front desk and they walked us through it step-by-step. Of course, if you don't have an international cell phone, this would be a problem. Once we arrived, the location was great. Very close to San Marco's square and the vaporetto stops, and in easy walking distance to other neighborhoods. The view of the canal out of our windows was beautiful, and we could even hear the gondoliers singing. It could get noisy, but shutters on the windows helped. Overall, the hotel was clean and in a great location. But at the rate of 580 euros per suite per night, it was lacking any extras and certainly had no examples of â€œluxury.â€� We expected much more comfort and service at such a high rate.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Sar_hudds
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic location!! It makes so much difference being really close to absolutely everything. The hotel is a little tricky to find, down a back street off the North Eastern corner of St Marks square. I recommend printing off the Expedia directions to the hotel before trying to find it. The (standard) room was really clean with good decor, appropriate to the general style and periods one would expect. The beds were comfy and the carpet clean. In our room the carpet even seemed new, very plush! The bathroom is also very clean and included a bidet, the only downside being there was no bath (rm 11) which is disappointing when the weather is really cold. The hotel is very quiet, however you can hear the bells of St Marks from the room and occasional activity/singing from Gondoliers on the canals at the back of the hotel. The staff were really friendly and very helpful and spoke very good English. The restaraunts in the immediate area varied greatly. We would definitely not recommend Da Celio which was overpriced and virtually inedible!! Airport tip: Turn left out of the airport building and follow the white semi-covered walkway to the ferry (Alilaguna) 12 Euros to the mainland, instead of getting the bus which takes forever and is usually crowded!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great staff. . .”
Reviews.Author: adelaidetaylor
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a tour, along with plane, train, and transfer reservations for Rome, Florence, and Venice. We were very pleased with the location, and feel we got an excellent room for our money. We didn't ask for an upgrade even though our elegant room faced the outer wall of another building over a narrow walkway. There were plenty of views of the city to be had by just walking a short distance. The breakfast was fine, with hot choices as well as juices,cold cuts, cheeses, yogurts, fruits, cereals and pastries. We were within moments of St. Mark's Square and could hear the New Year's Eve celebration going on. Our phone didn't work properly, which was a problem because we had some money / credit issues to resolve, but the management dialed all the numbers for us. Also, our TV didn't work, but the staff also promptly replaced it. Overall, we would recommend this hotel as a value considering the outrageously high prices in the city of Venice. Do not plan on eating in the All'Angelo restaurant, even though you can get a discount from the hotel. The food is overpriced and not as good as it could be.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful find”
Reviews.Author: MarkNYCity
Reviews.Content: A small hotel hidden just off St. Mark's Square. Beautiful large room, with a large marble bathroom. The room where breakfast is served has a balcony overlooking the canal. A real gem.

Reviews.Title: “Rooftop Hot tub Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Amca123
Reviews.Content: Booked the executive suite for last two nights of our honeymoon. A little more expensive than the suite but worth evey penny. Room was huge!! Few steps up to super private rooftop terrace plus hot tub. Amazing view across the city. Didnt want to leave the rooftop but had to do a bit of sightseeing! Staff were excellent, especially considering the bank machine swallowed our card on the final day of our honeymoon = no money to pay bill!! Staff were more than helpful . Will def return to dona palace, would recommend arrive/depart by water taxis!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the suite, worth the money”
Reviews.Author: tavia14999
Reviews.Content: Wanted to stay centrally and the Donna Palace has an amazing location. Going in November meant we could take advantage of the low season and get a good deal. We went for a canal facing suite which at 195 Euro wasn't the cheapest room we could get but were paying for extra luxury and we were very pleased with the room with three windows onto the canal, we were regularly treated to singing gondoliers going past. (only at sensible times though). The rooms were a nice temperature and it was lovely to have the extra sitting room to relax in. Breakfast was nice, although the cooked element wasn't brilliant but it isn't very italian thing to do. The rooms were clean and had lovely furniture in it. The staff were helpful and very attentive. They tried to go out of their ways with extra touches like a free welcome drink and leaving drink. The only downside was a slightly dodgy whirlpool bath. I had to get someone to show me how to work it which involved switching on the power at the circuit and then it kept coming on and off. It was funny though and very bubbly. Got the hotel taxi to the airport and absolutely loved leaving in style. Much more glamourous than the aliguna which we got on the way into Venice. It was 70 euro through the hotel which was a good saving. I loved Venice at the end of November, I've been at the end of October before and found November much more pleasant. It is much quieter, the queues for historic sights were smaller and actually non existant on the Monday. I'd recommend eating at the Alle Testierre if you like fish and Trattoria da Arturo (also listed as vina da arturo) if you want meat or vegetarian food. Both are tiny though and very popular with locals and visitors so will need to be booked in advance. Also they aren't cheap but the food is beautiful

Reviews.Title: “Super Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: galavanter
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so handy to everything. We arrived via Alilaguna boat from Marco Polo airport & found the hotel quite easily given the directions in a few minutes.The room we had was small but perfect otherwise - we heard that some of the other rooms were bigger but we were happy enough. Breakfast was very good & goes through to 10.30 am should you fancy a lie in. They did not give us free Bellinis as stated in previous reviews just 20% off a drink on the day of arrival - we did feel like using it that evening but did have cocktail on the last night - nice little touchs added . We did not use the hotel's 3 local restaurants as we wanted to go to other areas. Tourist menus varied from 12 - 22 euros but the wine can catch you out - we paid 38euros for a bottle of Pinot Grigio .Each evening whilst we were out our beds were turned down & the weather/welly forecast was left with some sweets. We did not need the wellies but San Marco square was prepared for high tides with foot high bench walkways stacked up waiting. The hotel is quiet but you can hear the bells from the square & the gondolas early in the morning . We took the vaporetta to Murano - don't get off until the Murano Museo stop or you will be 'invited ' to a tiny little glass factory - there are others bigger better & more central. Hotel Taxi to airport 70 euros

Reviews.Title: “The Smallest Hotel Room in Europe”
Reviews.Author: honeymoonjb
Reviews.Content: After much deliberation I booked Dona Palace for Halloween for 4 adults and one child, based on reviews in Tripadvisor. I booked a double and a triple room. I was led to believe that the hotel would do everything it could to make a special event, special - upgrades/wine on arrival etc. It was both an anniversary and a birthday celebration, so I contacted the hotel directly to check if an upgrade was available, or at least a room with a canal view. I was sent a price list, but emailed prior to arrival again requesting the upgrade and said it would be worth it. I read on Tripadvisor that the rooms were "palatial" - ours was the TINY room trapped between the lift (noise all night) and the bar/restaurant (clanking glasses all night and the smell of food from 6am) on the third floor. The bathroom - to reach the toilet we had to close the door to avoid injury, as the toilet was actually behind the door which swung open all on it's own. Our room was directly above the main door of the hotel. When we arrived I requested a room change immediately, but was told there was nothing available and to check again in the morning, so I did. I was told that this would cost 150 euros per night extra for each of the 2 nights. The staff checked I'd emailed and whilst they were apologetic, they did nothing to even change our room to another of the "same" standard. The other couple and their daughter who travelled with us also had a "standard" room - but this was on the fourth floor and was huge in comparison - fair dues, but the receptionist told me that theirs was the same standard as our room - it wasn't even in the same league! Oh, and the view - on the website it states that EVERY room has either a view of the canal or courtyard. There was no mention of the wall of the opposite building, which we could nearly touch - out of BOTH windows. I was so disappointed with this hotel. On the plus side, the hotel was close to San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “An Authentic Venice Experience”
Reviews.Author: reefscape
Reviews.Content: If there is one hotel experience I wouldn't hesitate recommending, it would be Dona Palace in Venice. It probably ranks amoung the best when it comes to situation in Venice. We actually divided our stay in Venice between two hotels. The other hotel was much less central and, although they had nice rooms and a very decent breakfast, we wish we would have spent the whole week at Dona Palace. Dona Palace, as we understand it, was once a residence for one of the Doges. It is right on the same canal which runs behind the Doge Palace. We had a side-view from our room onto the canal and a small bridge over the canal. When you step out of the hotel you are a stones-throw to Saint Mark's square and if you go the other way you will encounter several small bridges over a fork in the canals running behind the hotel. The breakfast room was also amazing, adding to that true Venice experience. It is probably in what was once the "grand sal" of what was once that Doge residence. The included breakfast was, in my opinion, of 4 star value, and in the afternoons it was possible to order a wine and sit on the balcony overlooking the canal underneath. As most hotels in Venice are expensive, you will have to spend some extra money anyway for lodging, and I believe that the difference between what you pay at a "cheaper" location will not make up for what you will lose in terms of a very authentic Venice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location -- huge room!”
Reviews.Author: The_Madcap_Gadfly
Reviews.Content: The Dona Place is located couple of blocks off of St. Mark's Square. It's a great location for sure. We had an extemely large room, a suite, I think. It's furnishings were maybe dated by design standards but in great condition. I guess some people care about these things -- not me. The bathroom was also huge. The hair dryer are tube had a few holes in it due to it being yanked around, but what the heck. Wonderful breakfast included. The staff was friendly and very helpful and spoke great English.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Travelkit
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the first leg of our honeymoon for four nights during August. Booked a junior suite. Fantastic room overlooking hotel terrace and canal. Had informed hotel that we were staying there as part of our honeymoon and when we arrived there was a bottle of asti spumante in our room and a congratulatory note for us. Huge room, very clean and comfortable with spacious bathroom. Only a short stroll to St Mark's Square. Found staff to be helpful. Only downside: no iron in room (not permitted under Italian law, apparently). Laundry and pressing service was available, but it's off-site. We rang one evening about 7.30pm to get some clothes pressed before we went out for the evening and were told the service wasn't available until the next day as the cleaning staff had left for the evening. So be warned: bring a travel iron. Apart from that, no problems. Very generous breakfast buffet and if you're early enough and the weather's ok, you can sit out on the balcony overlooking the adjacent canal while you eat. Late one afternoon we sat there and ordered cocktails, which arrived with a tray of canapes, and other snacks. Next day did the same: no canapes that time. So, lack of consistency that way. But generally can't fault the hotel at all. Really a fantastic spot.

Reviews.Title: “A Palace in Venice”
Reviews.Author: nucleon
Reviews.Content: We came to Venice to pick up a cruise, and stayed in the 555 Euro/night Westin the first evening. It was quite nice, but one doesn't need to spend that kind of money for a nice room. At the end of our cruise, we took a water taxi from the port to San Marco Plaza, as the driver didn't know how to go directly to the Dona Palaces dock (or wouldn't attempt it for whatever reason). So we ended up walking with our bags, but fortunately, the hotel is only about 2 blocks from the northern edge of the square. The hotel was delightful. This was indeed an old palace, which had most recently been a bank, but was converted to a hotel 4 years ago. The room (#24) was palatial, with high ceilings having intricate wood work, and a huge though capped fireplace. The bath was entirely new and modern, and had a separate 2.5x2.5 foot shower. I mention this because the shower at the more expensive Westin was LESS than 2x2 feet square! There was a modern wood divider separating the huge room from a smaller second bedroom area. Not much of a view, but you can walk outside for that. The only glitches involved the front desk. They could not cash a traveller's cheque, and there was considerable pressure to take a "free" trip to the glass factories at Murano. The internet went down one evening, and I could not convince the fellow at the desk that it was their system and not my computer at fault. It came back up later in the day. The breakfast was included (although we were charged 40Euro for the morning we arrived), and while not particularly lavish, it was quite good with considerable variety. Overall, this hotel was delightful, and I would stay again if I should ever return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Piazza San Marco”
Reviews.Author: TrapezeFlyer
Reviews.Content: This is an absolute "find" for Venice. An honest 4 star hotel located on a quiet street, only 3 blocks from the tourist center of Piazza San Marco. Ask for room 26, a corner suite on the second floor. The HUGE bedroom looks out on the central courtyard while the living room window is directly above the same canal as the fabled Bridge of Sighs. In the afternoon you will be seranaded by the gondoliers passing just beneath your window. The bathroom is all marble with a jacuzzi tub. The breakfast, served in a lovely dining room is adequate. At 250 Euros (booked on Venere.com) it's not a bad deal for very expensive Venice. You can save the 100 Euro water taxi (which deposits you directly at the courtyard entrance) by taking the vaporetto (the nautical equivalent of a public bus) to the San Marco stop and then walking 10 minutes to the hotel. However don't try this if you are overloaded with baggage (a great reason to travel light) as you'll have to negotiate the steps of 3 bridges which cross the canals between the vaporetto and the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Book this Hotel--You Will Love It!!!”
Reviews.Author: trvlnywr
Reviews.Content: Great Location, great staff, great food, clean. The location is superb, just off St. Mark's Square. Would definitely stay there the next time we travel to Venice. Stayed at the Donna Palace late July, just returned from Italy and none of the other hotels we stayed in came close to the Donna Palace. Little did we know we were seeing the best there was at the time.

Reviews.Title: “lovely place , excellent”
Reviews.Author: Steve_G_W
Reviews.Content: Loved the place , great room , great view of the canal. It is not the biggest place by any stretch of the imagination , however the rooms are a good size. There is a pleasant lounge , I am actually here now writing this review. The breakfast is ideal , something to suit everyone. It is located less than a minute's walk from San Marco Square , which is the centre of Venice. Breathtaking place. Can I recommend going to the Lido. It is beautiful and there are numerous beautiful beaches. It is 16 kilometres long !!! Can I recommend to those wishing to go the lido to hire a pedal bike from the shop opposite the water bus station. It is only 8 euros for the whole day. A great way of getting around. Enjoy the hotel all. I would put photos but the last set I tried to put on for this review crashed my computer so I wont bother this time. And also my girlfriend is asking why I dont go and buy her a drink.............. ciao !!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: conntraveler_7
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a Celebrity Millenium cruise ending in Venice. After reviewing a myriad of reviews of Venice hotels, we selected the Dona Palace. The location is ideal away from the noise and hustle of San Marco yet only two minutes walk away. The rooms are modern and upscale with amenities you would expect from a four star hotel. The hotel had a modern elevator and the air conditioning was fantastically cold. The hotel staff were all courteous and efficient. We along with another couple had trouble with our reservations (our travel agent's fault) and the front desk handled it with ease. The hotel has two distinct advantages: there is an expansive breakfast buffet (7:30-11:00 A.M.) included in the room price and an outdoor courtyard right off a canal where you can relax, read and get bar service. We used a private water taxi from the marine terminal that the ship uses for luggage pick-up (one minute walk from the terminal - 95 euros) which took us to the aforementioned dock of the hotel. Given four people and eight pieces of luggage, what a blessing! The hotel also ordered a water taxi to the Venice airport leaving directly from the hotel (85 euros up to 4 pieces of luggage then 1.5 euro extra per piece) again what a relief! We did not try the restaurants owned by the hotel. A block away parallel to the hotel is the upscale Di Forno. Finding the hotel: go the upper right corner of San Marco Square towards the canal. Before you reach the bridge you will see a large kodak sign hanging on the right side, turn left there and go straight a block and one-half and there is a small sign for Dona Palace on the right!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: lionbravo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Donna Palace on our honneymoon 14 till 17 May. The hotel is very nice (not very big) with nice clean rooms toward one litlle chanel. It has one pretty litle courtyard facing the channel where you can rest and see the gondolas movement. The better is the location near St. Marks but far fom the big crowds.In the zone are many restaurants one of the better is Al conte pescator . But in the castell zone there are much more an cheapper. The better way to get the hotel from the airport is by alilaguna boat till san marco and then walk 10 min. The breakfast is very good and served in a spacous and wonderfull place. Only thing we regret is staff that is not very calourous - they didn't do nothing after we told them that we are in honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mylisa1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel by reading other peoples experience on Trip Advisor. The hotel has it's own dock so the water taxi was able to drop us off right at the hotel. We were greated courteously and my husband and I were upgraded to the Honeymoon Suite. We had a whirlpool bathtub and seperate shower, sitting room and the ceilings must have been 3 stories high. My mother-in-law and brother-in-law had regular rooms but they were very nice as well. Hotel and rooms were very clean. Breakfast was very good and complete. Also the location of this hotel is hard to beat. We would stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: MiriamX
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend at Dona Palace. Very pleasant stay. On arrival we were allocated the largest room we have ever had in an Italian hotel . Our room was a corner room with three windows overlooking the canal. Breakfast was great and the hotel was steps away from St Mark's Square. Well worth the visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Esther32
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in April 2007. We booked a junior suite (Rm 48) which was quite large and had a view of a side canal. The room was very large and well appointed with free wifi. Two of three people at the front desk were very helpful and nice. The third person just had no warmth. The location of this hotel was perfect. 1 minute walk to St. Marks, a five to ten minute walk to the Vaporetto (depending on crowd density). The hotel has its own dock so if you take a water taxi to or from it, it is very convenient. They have their own water taxi that you can book with them at quite a lower rate than usual (50 euros to the cruise port for example). The breakfast reom is beautiful and has a full spread including eggs and bacon as well as pastries, cereals, fruits and yogurt. We would stay here again in a minute if we want to be in this part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place the Palace”
Reviews.Author: Will_30something
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a perfect 3 night stay in Venice. This was partly due to the location and quality of the Dona Palace. We were in room 26, it had a jacuzzi bath, sitting room and large double bedroom with views over the canal behind. For 880 Euros we thought it was lovely. The staff provided us with great recommendations for restauants every night and the included breakfast meant we were well filled up every morning. The only problem was finding the place initially. The street on which the hotel is on is not on any of the maps that I had sight of, however it was perversely quite easy to find. Just get off the vaparetto at St. Marks Square and walk in to the directly opposite corner, walking next to the palace patricale, then before you cross the bridge take the last left turn and if you head up that alley 50m, which then crosses another alley, then the Dona Palace is on the right hand side. It is much easier than it sounds and you will be grateful of its easy accessibility. Rialto Bridge is also within 3/5 mins walk, depending on your shop browsing! On the last night had one of the best meals ever at the Restaurante Antico Pignolo where Giovanni took extra special care of us. We arrived 5 mins early for our 8pm reservation, the table was not ready so we were asked to wait. Not really a problem, especially when we were given two glasses of champers each, then olives, then mozarella and tomatoes, then bread, then some wonderful risotto, by this stage we were thinking that we didn't need a meal. We were very pleased that we did though, superb melt in the mouth steak and sea bass, v. pricey, but so worth it! When arriving and leaving the best thing to do is catch the hotel's own water taxi, for 35 Euros. It is very cool pulling under the bridge of sighs and being dropped off only 75 metres away! All in all a wonderful weekend where my princess was pleased with my choice of palace!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: KammiB
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I booked this hotel for a surprise weekend away for my boyfriendâ€™s birthday. We went for 3 nights from March 9th 2007, and the whole stay was fab. We had a standard double which was a reasonable size and nicely decorated, the only thing we found was it tended to get very hot in the room, which wasn't a huge problem as we opened the windows, although be aware of the mosquitoes. Also the room we stayed 34 is directly above the kitchen area so it can get a bit noisey round breakfast time, which can be a problem if you don't intend getting up so early or are a light sleeper. The staff were very nice and helpful, I wanted to surprise my boyfriend on his b'day with a champagne breakfast in bed, however my boyfriend is a coeliac so obviously can't have the usual breads and pastries etc. The staff were very friendly and accommodating and made sure his breakfast was gluten free, they were also very discrete about the surprise. The day after the surprise breakfast, when we went down for breakfast as normal the waiter bought out some gluten free crackers for him so they must have bought them esp after they found out he was a coeliac which I thought was very sweet. The hotel is 5 mins away from the st marks square and very conveniently located. For food we didn't go to any of the restaurants near the square, recommend walking a bit further away and going somewhere where the locals eat. We found our best meals were at the two places we went on our last two nights. One was an Oestria (family owned) and another modern restaurant. Both places had locals eating there and their menus were in Italian, no translated menus to attract tourists. The staff are more then happy to translate the menu for you, and these places were not as pricey as the other restaurants we came across near the square or the one we ate at on the first night which had average food but highly priced. Also to any other coeliacs out there worried about going to Venice, the food is not a problem. Restaurants know about the allergy and seem quite informed (the places we went to were). Alot of the tourist places do mainly pizza and pasta dishes but majority of restaurants do a fair bit of seafood and not as much pizza and pasta as you may expect. So food was never a problem for my boyfriend.

Reviews.Title: “Great All Rounder”
Reviews.Author: Cowley
Reviews.Content: I was taking my Mother for her 80th Birthday, so needed a Hotel in a good central location. The Hotel Dona Palace was just that, just off St Marks Square. We had a junior Suite (room 45), very comfortable and spacious room with jacuzzi bath (no tea making facilities though) good view onto the canal. Reception Staff very polite and helpful. Roberto the breakfast waiter and his staff were very attentive & the breakfast provided had a great choice. A lovely terraceed area to enjoy drinks on and also provides a docking stage for their own private boat. (which we went back to the airport on) They provided a free water taxi trip to Murano and glass factory, provided a free complimentary drink on our first night. The whole trip was great and the Hotel was conveniently situated for all attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a first time to Venice”
Reviews.Author: kristaWales
Reviews.Content: We are 2 female friends in our 40s and travelling for the first time independently - i.e. booking our own flights and hotel. We wanted to be safe and comfortable and the reviews about this Hotel hit the mark. We were travelling from Treviso and were advised to get a return bus fare and 3 day vaporetti pass. When we got to Venice we found the right stand to get 'into town' after some confusion and it was raining. We had been advised the hotel was equidistant to Rialto and San Marco - we got off at Rialto but found it quite confusing to find the hotel. My advice is to get off at San Marco - longer on the boat but shorter on the legs! We had a standard room that was snug - the beds were singles (I had requested a twin room) but pushed together - we're good friends but not that good. There was some room to move them apart but not much. However the room was a minor niggle as we weren't in it much and actually paying for a basic room in a good hotel meant that we had the facilities that one would expect of a hotel with deluxe suites - the breakfast area and breakfast was excellent, as was the courtyard. Our room was very quiet. We would definitely go back. We ate at one of the affiliated hotel restaurants and would not recommend it - very ordinary and the discount still does not make it value for money. For other meals we followed recommendations in guide books and had great (if dear) food. I would recommend the Doges palace for a visit (beware we spend 5 hours there and missed lunch - but worth it - there is a coffee shop well worth a visit to break up the trip) Best bit of the trip was the Vaporetti - we spent one whole day on it and it was a wonderful way to see Venice

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lizarm
Reviews.Content: Venice: Dona Palace February 2007 Reviewer: Three Female Trip Advisor members Three of us - all over sixty and interested in painting - stayed here in February. The hotel has been converted from an old palace and is very well placed, just behind St Marco's square, making sight seeing and shopping in that area very convenient. You could just about see the Bridge of Sighs from our window! The rooms were large, elegantly furnished, comfortable, well appointed and spotlessly clean. Everyone in Reception was very friendly, spoke excellent English and gave us helpful tips on finding our way round. We had free Bellini cocktails the first night and the breakfasts were delicious. There was no restaurant but the hotel owns several restaurants close by where they offer 15% discount. The food here, however, was pretty standard tourist Italian fare. The hotel has its own landing stage and water taxi but unfortunately this was broken when we were there. They fixed up for us to have a water taxi from the airport through another firm but it was expensive - 120 Euros. The return taxi from the hotel was cheaper at 85 Euros. We would all go back and stay at this hotel. The location is incredible and it has a friendly intimacy and elegance that makes a stay very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding hotel & service”
Reviews.Author: macfamilyNj
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nts at this beautiful hotel & we cannot say enough good things about it. it's in a great location.the hotel is beautiful with great amenities. the breakfast included was incredibly good. They even offered a welcome coktail! But it ws their service which really won us over. We forgot our passports in our previous hotel & they called them & made all the arragements to have them express mailed to us. We received them in less than 24 hrs! we'd definitively would go back.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: jayjaygee
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a whirlwind 3 days in Venice. We stayed at the Dona Palace which is a delightful small hotel located just behind St Mark.s Square and within easy walking distance of all the main attractions. We followed instructions on how to find this hotel from a previous review----thankyou very much. We were there in minutes after landing at the water taxi rank at San Marco. Our room was ready and was delightful. Large beautifully furnished and with a huge luxury bathroom.. We were offered a welcome drink and shown to the bar. We had breakfast here and that too was lovely. A combination of Italian and American.......wide selection and in a lovely setting.. After 3 days of wonderful sight seeing I was able to check in online at reception and also booked a private water taxi for our return trip to the airport. This ended our break in style and we highly r ecommend this hotel.It was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, good customer service”
Reviews.Author: poodleby
Reviews.Content: overall a good experience apart from on the third day i had a problem with the shower cubicle: the perspex door was unsecured and slid off its runners, falling onto the other side of the shower. the hotel reacted way beyond my expectations: within 10 mins i was upgraded to a suite and later when i came back to the room the hotel manager had provided a bottle of brut on ice and a luxurious cake with a personal apology. clearly the hotel takes this kind of thing seriously. the hotel itself is spotless, breakfast is nice and includes scrambled eggs and bacon, the reception staff are incredibly polite. i couldn't have got better value for money anywhere else in venice during december and i'd done enough research before i went. the proximity to the square is very convenient for the vaporetto stop.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute perfection”
Reviews.Author: Bren H
Reviews.Content: My husband & I returned from our first trip to Venice yesterday and I have to write to say how wonderful this hotel is. It is so closely located to San Marco and yet, being in a side alley backing onto a small canal, it is very quiet. We checked in and the porter took our luggage to the room (23). We were a bit concerned because our room was directly off of the lounge bar/dining room but we need not have worried. Apart from hearing the breakfast being prepared at about 7am each morning, the noise was very minimal. The room was amazing....it was so big and lushly carpeted in red with a huge king size bed and loads of lovely brass lights. The huge bathroom was also amazing.....2 basins, a shower cubicle and a whirlpool bath. We had a curtesy room safe and a well stocked mini bar with very good red and white wime and bottles of sparkling wine as well as every spirit and mixer you could require and it was replenished daily. The room was scrupulously clean and the bed sheets were changed every day. The complimentary 'American' buffet breakfast was faultless. As previous reviews state there was fresh fruit salad, yogurts, croissants, rolls, jams, marmalade, cheese, boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, bacon, cold meats and a selection of cakes every morning. They supplied any type of coffee you request. we requested decaffeinated and it was no problem at all, equally you could drink cappucinno....whatever and the gentleman who oversaw breakfast truly was a gentleman who made you feel very important. Sadly, it being November the weather wasn't warm enough for us to benefit from the charming courtyard but I imagine it would be wonderful to enjoy a drink sitting there on the canal at sunset as it is a lovely setting. Reception staff varied. When we asked about help with our on line check, one receptionist simply directed us to the nearest Internet cafe although they clearly have Internet access on the desk. Later that day when the shift had changed I asked Stephanie the same question and she willingly logged on to BA.Com and checked us in on line, it taking only a fews seconds. It pays to check who is on duty. Overall we could not fault this hotel, would not hestitate to stay there again or to recommend it. Its is the best, definitely a 4-star and very reasonably priced for its location.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: sdimitri
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for my wife and i. We went to Italy for our honeymoon and stayed at Dona Palace for 2 nights, the best nights of our honeymoon!! The only mistake we made was not to book a water taxi to transfer us infront of the hotel. After we arrived at the train station i asked the water taxis and they wanted 100 euros!!! So we took the water bus. It was ok but crowded. After getting off at the San Marco stop we followed the instractions other travellers left in this site and despide the fact we had to climb two bridges with steps to get to the San Marco square the hotel was not that hard to find after that. Because we stayed for 2 weaks in Italy we had heavy suitcases and it was hard to carry for that distance, specialy for my wife. The hotel has a water taxi and transfers you for 35 euro. I recoment you to book that taxi. We took it after we left from the hotel to transfer us to the train station. I book a normal double room and they upgraded us to the suite for free. What a surprise!!! The room was excellent, very clean, large, lcd and the best of it a private veranda with view of San Marco and Venice. It also had a hot tub and it was really nice relaxing with the view of Venice. People working there where very friendly and helpfull. Our second evening we ordered a room service dinner from the restaurant of the hotel, which is near the hotel (prices are logical for Venice) and we had it on the private veranda of our room. That was really romantic and one of the best moments of our honeymoon. Just Perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: ElvisinLA
Reviews.Content: Visited Venice for three nights in early October. We really enjoyed our stay here. Arrived on the private dock via water taxi like many other reviewers. Also arranged for water taxi to airport with hotel. Price was a reasonable (for Venice) 55 Euro for two. Our room and bed were large, clean and comfortable with a nice side view of the canal and patio. Great A/C, plenty of hot water and an excellent breakfast were all big pluses. Staff was helpful and accomodating. Only one complaint: Had drinks on patio one late afternoon and the bartender/waiter kept the change when we paid. It was 3+ Euro. Not the end of the world, but there was not doubt he wasn't bring it back. Bad form and very rare. Location of this place is great too, just off of a fairly quiet little street and literally a stones throw from St. Mark's. Really no need to bother with restaurant recommendations from the hotel, there are dozens of good restaurants all over Venice. Just do a little exploring and you'll find them.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: JackieMH
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel by water taxi which had been arranged by our tour operator. First impressions excellent. All the front desk staff were polite and courteous and extremely helpful. Small outside seating area overlooking canal. Room was very spacious, beautifully decorated and clean. Bathroom tastefully decorated with shower, bidet, loo and sink. Rooms spotlessly cleaned every day. On the second floor is the breakfast area which doubles up as an area to drink in the evening with a small bar at one end. Breakfast was adequate and waiting staff were friendly. Bar open in the evening and bar staff very pleasant. There is a small balcony with a couple of tables and chairs to sit out and take in the view of the canal. Hotel is situated just round the corner from San Marco and only 5 minutes to the Rialto Bridge so well placed for all sightseeing. Hotel does not have a restaurant so found some lovely ones on our wanders. Can recommend the Trattoria alla Madonna which is over the Rialto bridge, turn left and 2nd alleyway on the right. This restaurant is used by lots of locals and prices are reasonable. Will definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Super honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: mcconaj
Reviews.Content: Fantastic palace! Rooms! Staff!! Ambiance!!! Incredible breakfast buffet with a gentleman supervising the breakfast show that is shear perfection! We lost our luggage for three days and the staff was exceptional in assisting us in our situation. Rooms were perfection. If in Venice, and you want to avoid the clutter of the Grand Canal, stay close to San Marco, and receive exceptional service. Tthis is the only place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - would return tomorrow!”
Reviews.Author: P_B-Scotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at end Aug 06. Room was perfect, really large, lovely red carpet, great bed. Bathroom was spotless and huge - great double shower. The room for breakfast was so nice with a little balcony if you were lucky enough to get one of the tables. Breakfast was great. Has a lovely little terrace with it's own dock where you can sit and watch all the gondola's go past. We even bought our own wine & bread, cheese, cold meats etc.. and sat there whilst the sun was setting which was great. Location is perfect, couple of minutes walk from St Mark's Square which couldnt be better. Was really reasonable - best hotel during our whole stay in Italy and would only book there if and when we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and location!”
Reviews.Author: Cruise_Addict
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Europe, we had no idea what to expect. We were pleasantly surprised by this wonderful hotel, located on one of the canals and just off of St. Mark's Square. The rooms are nice - luxurious. There were six of us who stayed in this hotel, in three rooms. We were in room 11 - spacious room, the bathroom was nice but on the smallish size, two windows with a nice view of the courtyard. We saw room 50 (at the top floor of the hotel). It wasn't as nice as room 11, but it was larger. The other room we saw, 21(or was it 20?), was large with a very nice balcony. The person from our group who stayed in this room was in a wheelchair/on crutches and able to get around in this room very well. Don't miss the sumptuous breakfast offering delicious continental fare (parstries, croissants, juice, coffee, fresh mozzarella, etc.) as well as scrambled eggs and bacon. The dining room is very pleasant and has a balcony where you can eat and enjoy the sights and sounds of the canal. The small courtyard (that others have mentioned) is a really pleasant place to relax any time - day or night. We loved watching the gondolas go by. The location is fabulous. There is a bank (with ATM), wonderful restarants and teriffic shopping right next door. A few tips: 1. As in most European hotels, you have to put your room key in a slot inside the room to turn on the electrical. 2. If going to the airport from this (or any other Venice) hotel, check your taxi options. Six family members and their 20 pieces of luggage paid only 60 Euro at 3pm. My husband and I, with four pieces of luggage paid 85 Euro at 7am. 3. Avoid the little courtyard right at dusk as that seems to be when the mosquitos come out. We will definitely make this our hotel of choice whenever visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: Nikkidog
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews for this hotel, I was a little skeptical, but upon arrival we were pleasantly surprised! We, out of necessity (too many bags and small children), had to take a water taxi from the train station. It was wonderful, esp. when we were able to be delivered right to the hotel's "dock". We found the people at the front desk fairly helpful and friendly. Our rooms were enormous!!! We were on the 4th floor.....both rooms faced the canal, one of which was a corner room because we had a "triple". The views were amazing! After some of the nightmare rooms we'd experienced during our stay in Italy, this was a welcome relief!!

Reviews.Title: “A Palace Not Fit For a King”
Reviews.Author: MistressofthePark
Reviews.Content: To be fair, this is a 3 star hotel and we generally stay in higher quality hotels, so our expectations may be above the norm. Once we found the hotel, no easy task, the location was great. It was within steps of St. Marks square and other major attractions. The rooms were small, clean and efficient. The hotel has a pretty courtyard on the canal, but it was not very user freindly. Some of the rooms, we noted, were accessed through the dining area/breakfast room. If you don't want everyone staring at you while you access your room, you may wantt to request one with access through the hallway and not the diningroom. While the hotel is very close to heavily trafficked St. Marks, it was quiet. The staff knew only the restaurants with which they were affiliated. The food was ok. For those who want to be within a short walk of St. Marks and the Grand Canal at a very reasonable price, this is a good deal. If you require a little more luxury, look elsewhere.
